Since she has experience in making them, Umida wants to start a business in sewing "kurpacha," the traditional mattresses  She plans to use the income from her business to provide her children with good educations and calorie-rich foods.  She is requesting the loan to buy a sewing machine so she can start her new business.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to start a new business

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg is 23 years old. He lives in the Akhalkalaki District with his mother. He has asked for loans from local financial institutions to start up a new business several times but has not had success. His loan requests were rejected each time because of low income and lack of experience in his job, which is usually demanded by local credit providers.
The only source of income for the family is the small monthly income earned by Gevorg’s mother working as a cleaner locally. Gevorg used to have a business where different kinds of fruits and vegetables were sold, but he stopped this because he joined military service. He has recently returned from service and decided to restart his trading business, but his current savings are not enough to implement his plan.
His loan request was approved as part of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up and re-startup credit with soft conditions to the rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Gevorg will purchase fruit and vegetables at wholesale prices and take them to sell at his open market store. Gevorg plans to increase the turnover in his trade business gradually. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of his family. Gevorg will work hard and will be able to improve the living conditions for himself and his family. Along with the above mentioned, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Al-Taisir Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Taisir which consists of five women who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Nasrin is 26 years old, married and has three children who also live in Sana`a, Yemen. She has a car and she has applied for a youth loan of 50000 YER from AMB to buy spare parts for her car.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her car

loans.name: Muhlisa

texts.ru: Мухлиса является одним из таких личностей, которая старается улучшить условия жизни и стимулировать экономическое состояние семьи. Ей 28 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее муж Хамза работает плотником и получает маленькую зарплату. Мухлиса решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она имеет навыки о бизнесе. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей  скота. У нее есть 1000 сомон сбережения. Она запрашивает займ добавок еще 1000 сомон для покупки 4 голов барана. От полученного дохода она планирует купить все не обходимые современные технологии и мебель и таким образом внести свой вклад для благо получения семьи. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Muhlisa is a kind of person who tries to improve the living conditions and stimulate economical situation in her family. She is 28 years old. She is married and is raising two children. Her husband Khamza works as a carpenter and receives small income. Muhlisa decided to help her husband for the well being of her family. With this goal she has taken a course at the Achieve Success organized by the Association of the Business Women and received a certificate. Now she has new business skills. She wants to start a business buying and selling cattle. She has 1,000 somoni in savings. Muhlisa is asking for a loan in additional 1,000 somoni to buy four heads of sheep. She plans to buy all the necessary modern technology and furniture from the received profit and this way do her part in the well being of her family. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy four sheep to start a new business.

loans.name: Shohida

texts.ru: Шохида молодая и энергичная девушка. Ей 19 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. С детства она всегда мечтала стать богатой бизнес леди. Этот стимул помогает ей во многом. Она обучилась на курсе шитья и кройки. Уже несколько лет у нее есть опыт в этой сфере. Теперь она хочет реализовать своё ремесло в бизнес. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она вполне в состоянии создать свой бизнес, так как у нее есть навыки в этой сфере. Она будет шить национальные платья, и продать на местном рынке. Она планирует в месяц шить и 75 штук платьев и реализовать их, а также она будет принимать заказы местных жителей. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  1500 сомони для покупки швейной машинки и тканей, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Shohida is an energetic young woman.  She is 19 years old.  She isn't married and lives with her parents.  Since her childhood, she has always dreamed of becoming a wealthy businesswoman.  She studied in a course on dressmaking and she already has several years of experience in this field.  She now wants to turn her handicraft into a business.  With this aim, she studied in a course called "Attain Success" that is put on by the Association of Business Women, and she received her graduation certificate.  She is fully capable of starting her own business since she has the skills for this field.  

Shohida will sew traditional women's dresses and sell them at the local market.  She plans to make and sell 75 dresses per month, as well as taking special orders for dresses from local residents.  She is requesting a loan for 1,500 somoni (TJS) to buy a sewing machine and fabric in order to start her new business.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to start a new business

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in Hnaberd village of the Ararat region with her husband and two children. She is a teacher at a local school and is involved in agriculture. With the help of her husband Anahit grows peaches, apples, nuts and pear trees. Anahit also keeps a greenhouse where she grows strawberries. Because the agricultural business helps Anahit and her family to have stable income, Anahit would like to expand it. Her greenhouse is too old and it needs to be renovated so Anahit has applied for this loan to renovate the greenhouse. This will give her an opportunity to grow more fruits and vegetables and get higher income. With the other part of the loan Anahit plans to purchase fertilizer.
The loan is very important for Anahit and her family because it will help to gather good harvest and have higher income.

loans.use: to pay for renovations of the greenhouse and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Rysbubu

texts.ru: Рысбубу 65 лет, вдова. Рысбубу имеет высшее педагогическое образование после окончания школы она вышла замуж. Она является являются пенсионером, помимо пенсии источником дохода для их семьи является животноводство и полеводство. Благодаря упорному труду Рысбубу в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 дойные коровы, 1 и 40 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рысбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота – молодняка для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Рысбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины и копит на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Rysbubu is 65 years old and a widow.  Rysbubu has a higher education in teaching, having married after graduating.  She is a retiree, but aside from her pension their family's income comes from animal husbandry and farming.  As a result of Rysbubu's hard work, she now has two milk cows, 40 sheep, and one head of other cattle.  

With an aim to further developing her business, Rysbubu applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy young cattle, which she will fatten and sell.  Rysbubu plans to invest the profits from the loan in further increasing the number of cattle she has and to save up for home repairs.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bulls

loans.name: Guliston

texts.ru:
Гулитон добрая женщина из кишлака. Она родилась в кишлаке и выросла здесь и очень хорошо адаптировалась в кишлачной образе жизни. Она знает все тонкости восточной жизни и очень умело использует свои навыки в реализации своих планов в условиях кишлака. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Она всегда старается для благо получения семьи. С раннего утра она занята домашними делами, а какие большие и вкусные лепешки она печет, «пальчики оближешь» - говорит ее муж. 
Несмотря на поддержку, друг друга, Гулистон и ее муж не могут улучшить условию проживания. Гулистон решила организовать свой бизнес для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес с купле продажей  скота, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  1000 долларов США для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ей улучшить условию проживания.
texts.en:
Guliston is a good woman from the countryside.  She was born and raised in this village and she is very well adapted to the village way of life.  She knows all the ins and outs of eastern life and she skillfully uses her know-how to put her plans into action in the village setting.  Guliston is married and has one child.  She always tries her hardest for the family's well-being.  She starts doing household chores early in the morning and she bakes such big and tasty flatbreads that her husband calls them "finger-licking good."

Despite their support of one another, Guliston and her husband aren't able to improve their living conditions, so Guliston decided to start her own business for the family's well-being.  With this aim, she studied in a course called "Attain Success" that is put on by the Association of Business Women, and she received her graduation certificate.  She wants to start a business trading cattle, since she has experience in this field.  

She is requesting a loan of $1,000 (USD) to buy cattle in order to start her business.  She is relying on your kindness.  This loan will help her improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start a new business

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a married man living in the Likoni area of the coast province in Kenya. He has one child. Ezekiel runs a shoe selling shop that has been in operation for the last nine years providing income for the family.

He was introduced to Milango by his friends and is asking for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to purchase pairs of shoes to resell over the festive season. The only challenge he faces is the high cost of stock. He believes the income from this loan will help educate his child.

loans.use: to purchase pairs of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma, 33 years old, is from the small village of the Lanchkhuti district. She has a large family with a husband, 2 children and parents-in-law, who are provided with a retirement pension. 

The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have 3 milk cows and 5 calves. They also have a plot of agricultural land where maize, tangerine trees and nut trees are grown. They sell the harvested products locally at a good price. 

Irma is a very hard working woman who works to insure in a good harvest. She requested a loan for purchasing feed for the cattle. After purchasing the feed, the cattle will fatten properly. This will increase the income of the family. With the increased income they will improve their living conditions. Irma awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the cattle.

loans.name: Mosharif

texts.ru: Трудное условие жизни заставляет человека направлять все свои усилия и мотивировать существующие ресурсы. Мошариф является одним из таких личностей, которая старается улучшить условия жизни и стимулировать экономическое состояние семьи. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее муж получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами.  Мошариф  решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей продуктов питания. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает кредит на сумму  1000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Difficult living conditions force a person to use all their efforts and their existing resources.  Mosharif is just such a person and is trying to improve her living conditions and boost her family's economic standing.  She is married and has two children.  Her husband earns a small salary that isn't enough to provide the family with all the necessities.  Mosharif decided to help her husband with the family's well-being.  

With this goal in mind, she studied in a course called "Attain Success" that is put on by the Association of Business Women, and she received her graduation certificate.  Now, she is fully able to start a business and to be successful in her field.  She wants to start a grocery business.  She plans to use her profits to provide her children with good educations and calorie-rich foods.

Mosharif is requesting a loan of 1,000 somoni (TJS) to buy grocery items in order to start her new business.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to start a new business

loans.name: Ndunda

texts.en:
Ndunda lives in the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has three children. She owns a green grocer which she has been operating for five years. In this business, Ndunda sells vegetables like tomatoes, kale, etc. She began the business from the income from the farming business.

Ndunda learned about Milango through a friend with the aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenges she is facing are price fluctuations and inflation, purchasing stock and the seasonal business climate.

Ndunda is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy vegetable at wholesale prices. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to purchase a piece of land and build a residential house in addition to helping educate her children.

loans.use: to buy vegetables at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Fardos Group

texts.en:
This group is called Fardos which consists of 5 ladies who work hard to to maintain a good family life. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 250,000 YER. 

Tahany is the leader of this group. She is 22 years old. She is a housewife who works hard to improve her living standards. She applied for a youth loan of 50000 YER from AMB to buy home appliances for her home. She hopes to renew her home.

loans.use: to buy home appliances for her home.

loans.name: Lamara

texts.en:
Lamara is a 55-years-old widow and lives in Gori with her daughter. Several times, Lamara has requested loans from local financial institutions for her trading business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of low income and the lack of experience in her new business, which is usually demanded by local credit providers. The only source of income for the family is the small monthly income earned by Lamara, who is involved in a clothing trading business. 

She buys clothing in Turkey and resells these items to local retailers. Lamara requested a loan from Credo to start up her own store and sell the clothing herself. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of a business start-up, and re-startup credits, with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Lamara will purchase clothes in Turkey for wholesale prices and resell them in her store for a profit. It will be hard work for Lamara, but according to estimations, her business will be profitable and will increase the income of the family. The increased profit will be reinvested in clothing trading to increase her stock and sales volume. The family members will be able to earn some savings and buy their own house. Lamara awaits your support.

loans.use: to start up a clothing store.

loans.name: Sakit

texts.en:
Sakit is 32-years-old, married with two children. He sells food products such as macaronis, rice, candies, cookies, sugar and beverages in his shop. Sakit has 6 years of experience in this field and he is considered to be a knowledgeable and skilled person.

The food products he sells are very popular among people and are in high demand. His monthly profit from selling foods is 125 AZN. His wife helps him to sell products in shop. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of his good location in the central bazaar of his home city.

Sakit would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 1000 AZN. He will purchase and diversify additional food products. This will be his 2nd loan and he has a positive credit history.

loans.use: to invest more capital to buy more food products.

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka lives in the Kobuleti District. He is 45 years old, single and lives with his retired father. Mamuka is, at the moment, unemployed. The only source for the family is agricultural land, where they grow mandarins and sell seasonally. The family lives in poverty. According to Credo estimations, they belong to the vulnerable poor category. 

Mamuka decided to start his business as their existing income isn’t enough for the family and their living conditions are poor. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restartup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Mamuka will purchase a car and serve local people as a taxi driver. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve the living conditions of the family. Along with the above mentioned, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a car to use as a taxi.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is a 38 years old woman, married with two children. She is a market vendor and sells different kind of goods such as flour, beverages, macaronis, butter and candies. She has five years of experience and has a deep knowledge of the market and preferences of clients. 

The food product she sells are very popular among people and in high demand. Her monthly profit from selling foods is 120 AZN.  He husband helps to purchase the products and brings them to the shop. This work is the main financial income for her family because her husband works as a laborer and his job is not permanent. She is a very successful entrepreneur because of her good location in the central bazaar of her  home city.

She applied for 1500  AZN loan to purchase more food products and to diversify the range of goods to cover customers' demands. This will be her second loan and she has good client history.

loans.use: to buy more food products.

loans.name: Rafik

texts.en:
Rafik is still engaged in the fruits and vegetables trade business. With his previous loan from Kiva Rafik added to his fruit and vegetable assortment. He received a good profit which helped him to support his family's needs and to develop his business during this period. Now Rafik has a lot of regular customers which prefer to buy fruits and vegetables from Rafik’s stall because his fruits and vegetables for trade are fresh and affordable. 

Rafik expanded his trade and hopes to increase the number of his stalls in Sevan’s markets. Rafik asks from Kiva a 500.000 AMD loan to buy a large assortment of fruits and vegetables for reselling; especially citrus and tropical fruits for the New Year's holidays.

loans.use: to buy a large assortment of fruits and vegetables for reselling; especially citrus and tropical fruits for the New Year's holidays

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg is 38 years old and lives with her husband and 3 daughters in a Ger (yurt) in the Umnugovi province of Mongolia. Her husband, Tsogtbaatar, works as an operator in a private company. Her older 2 daughters Dolgoon, age 16 and Gartaam, age 14, go to a local secondary school and her youngest daughter Amin-Erdene, age 5, goes to a local kindergarten. 

She has been producing noodles from organic flour since 2010 at home. Her daughters and husband help her during the weekends and she supplies her noodles to 8 groceries stores. She is now requesting 1'500'000 MNT to cover her 3 daughters' school expenses and to purchase a computer for them to support their education from an early stage. She is a hardworking, neat and modest woman.

loans.use: to cover her 2 daughters' school expenses and purchase a computer for them to support their education from an early stage.

loans.name: Kholikul

texts.ru: Холикул проживает в Яванском районе. Ему 60 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Холикул занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. Он в основном выращивает зернобобовые культуры и овощи. Этим видом деятельности Холикул занимается восемь лет. Он берет кредит для закупа семян, чтобы посеять пшеницу.
texts.en: Kholikul lives in the Yavan region of Tajikistan. He is 60 years old, married, and has six children. Kholikul cultivates crops, mainly grains, legumes, and vegetables. He has been engaged in this activity for the past eight years. Kholikul is taking this loan to purchase seeds in order to sow wheat.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Bazaroy

texts.ru: Базарой проживает в Яванском районе. Ей 42 года. Она вдова. У нее пятеро детей. Базарой имеет средне - специальное образование, она преподавательница. Базарой преподает в средней школе района. В этой области она работает десять лет. Также она занимается растениеводством. Базарой выращивает капусту, картошку, свеклу и сеет пшеницу. Этим видом деятельности она занимается двенадцать лет. Базарой берет кредит для посева пшеницы.
texts.en: Bazaroy lives in the Yavan region of Tajikistan. She is 42 years old, widowed, and has five children. Bazaroy has specialized post-secondary education and works as a teacher at the region's high school. She has been in this job for ten years. Additionally, for the past twelve years, Bazaroy has been cultivating crops such as cabbage, potatoes, beets and wheat. She is taking this loan to sow wheat.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Umarali

texts.ru: Умарали житель Яванского района. Ему 33 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Умарали занимается торговлей. Он арендует торговую точку на рынке, где продает мужскую одежду и женскую обувь. Этим видом бизнеса Умарали занимается одиннадцать лет. Он берет кредит для покупки сезонного товара.
texts.en: Umarali lives in the Yavan region of Tajikistan. He is 33 years old, married, and has two children. Umarali is a merchant. He rents a retail spot at a market, from which he sells men's clothing and women's footwear. Umarali has been engaged in this business for eleven years. He is taking this loan to stock up on seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing and shoes

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru:
Сухроб житель Яванского района. Ему 37 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Сухроб занимается строительными работами по найму. Кроме того он занимается растениеводством. Сухроб на грядке выращивает овощи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается шесть лет. 
Сухроб берет кредит для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Suhrob lives in the Yavan region of Tajikistan. He is 37 years old, married, and has four children. Suhrob works as a contract construction worker. Additionally, he has been cultivating vegetables at home for the past six years. He is taking this loan to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Safarbek

texts.ru: Сафарбек житель города Дангара. Ему 42 года. Он женат. Сафарбек на протяжении шести лет занимается растениеводством. Он сеет пшеницу и подсолнух для продажи. Сафарбек берет кредит для закупа семян и топлива.
texts.en: Safarbek lives in the city of Dangara. He is 42 years old and married. For the past six years, Safarbek has been cultivating crops, such as wheat and sunflowers, for sale. He is taking this loan to purchase seeds and fuel.

loans.use: to sow wheat

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Karam Group

texts.en:
This group is called Karam and consists of five women who live in Sana`a, Yemen. 

Amah is 28 years old and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. Amah is a hardworking woman who has been selling many products, like clothes, perfumes and cosmetic materials. She is able to attract many clients who treated her politely. She applied for a youth loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to buy clothes and perfumes for her business. She hopes to own a house in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes and perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Mirsadiq

texts.en:
Mirsadiq is a 27 year-old-man who is single and lives with his parents. He sells food products, such as macaroni, rice, candies, cookies, sugar and beverages in his shop. Mirsadiq has four years of experience in this field, which considers him as a knowledgeable and skilled person. His father taught him the best because he was also an entrepreneur for many years.  

The food products that he sells are very popular among people and are in high demand. His monthly profit from selling food is 130 AZN. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of good location, in the central bazaar of his home city.

Mirsadiq would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN. He will purchase and diversify additional food items. This will be his third  loan and he has a positive credit history.

loans.use: to buy more food products for his business.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson lives in the Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has five children. He owns a crop farm business where he sells cereals. He has been operating this for twenty years. He began from a small-sized farm, mainly dealing in subsistence farming but has now grown into commercial farming including fruit/horticultural farming.

He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. The main challenge has been the harsh climatic conditions and lack of funds, a problem he sees partly sorted by this loan.

Nelson is applying for a loan of 67,900 Kenya shillings to buy farm inputs like seeds, fertilizers, and pay for ploughing and planting labour costs. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to expand the business. His dream is to see his business grow by increasing the size of acreage and to be able to sell more and contribute to food security in the area.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seeds, fertilizers and pay for labour costs.

loans.name: M'ituru

texts.en:
M'ituru lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He owns a tea tree farming business. He started the business from the income of subsistence farming; he also grows potatoes, maize, and vegetables on a small scale. The extract from the tea tree is used to manufacture cosmetics. M'ituru began the business of tea tree farming this year.

He learnt about Milango through an employee who invited him to the group and he joined the group with an aim of accessing credit. His main challenge has been the seasonal weather. This he believes will be sorted once he purchases a water pump.

M’ituru is applying for a loan of 15,869 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings and he looks forward to establishing the farm by increasing the acreage.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en:
Vahe is 39 years old .He lives in Vanadzor city with his wife, two daughters and son.

After school education, Vahe used to work in various places and positions. He doesn't have any specialization and it is too hard to find a good job to solve his big family needs. For more than five years, he has been working as a taxi driver using his own car. 

As Vahe admitted, being a taxi driver is a hard and difficult job, but this is the only job for Vahe with perceptible profit. Now Vahe is very much appreciated by his clients and he is able now to solve his family needs himself. 

Vahe needs a 300,000 AMD loan to buy four winter tires and to repair his car.

loans.use: To buy winter tires and to repair his car

loans.name: Murod

texts.ru: Мурод живет в районе Джалолиддин Руми. Он женат, имеет 3 детей. Ему 37 лет. Его сын работает в Российской Федерации. Его жена швея. Мурод хочет взять кредит для покупки швейной машинки для своей жены.
texts.en: Murod lives in the J.Rumy region.  He is 37 years old, married, and has three children.  His son works in the Russian Federation.  His wife is a seamstress.  Murod wants to take out this loan to buy a sewing machine for his wife.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for his wife

loans.name: Shukufa

texts.en:
Shukufa is a 57-year-old married woman with five children. Shukufa has been breeding cattle and cows for the past ten years. She and her husband live on a pension, which is too small. When they had jobs, they had enough salary, and breeding cows was not primarily the source of income. However, after retirement, living got harder, and now, breeding cattle and cows have become primarily the source of income in her family. 

Shukufa usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, then resells for more profitable prices in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 120 AZN and this business is the only source of financial income in her family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Shukufa also keeps milking cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors. 
 
She wants to expand her business and improve life conditions of her family. She applied for a 600 AZN loan to purchase one milking cow and fodder (feed). This will be her fourth loan and AqroInvest trust her.

loans.use: to buy one milking cow and fodder.

loans.name: Mazahir

texts.en:
Mazahir is a 49-year-old man who is married and has three children. He is a market vendor and sells different kinds of food products in the central bazaar. Mazahir has 15 years of experience in this field, which makes him a knowledgeable and skilled person.

He usually sells rice, macaroni, yogurt, flour, butter, sugar and others. Products he sells are in very high demand and people use them in everyday life. Also, these products are in very high demand among local people and his monthly profit is 120 AZN. His spouse helps him to update the merchandise in his shop. 

This business is the only one financial income for his family and Mazahir would like to increase his sales, as well as cover market demand. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN.  He will use this loan to purchase more products. This will be his third loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy more food products for resale.

loans.name: Sardar

texts.en: Sardar is 50 years old and married. His business is agriculture, selling milk products and meat. For more than 21 years he has been in animal husbandry, When he started his business, he had two milk cows, today their number has increased to four cattle. For the future, his plan is to build a store where he can sell the milk products. He wants a loan of 1600 AZN, and he will purchase two head of cattle.

loans.use: To buy two head of cattle.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He owns a tea tree farming business. He started the business from the income of subsistence farming. The extract from the tea tree is used to manufacture cosmetics. He began the business of tea tree farming this year.

He learnt about Milango through an employee who invited him to the group and he joined the group with the aim of accessing credit. The main challenge in the area has been the seasonal weather. This he believes will be sorted once he purchases a water pump.

Paul is applying for a loan of 11,910 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings and he looks forward to establishing the farm by increasing the acreage.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is from Yerevan. She lives with her husband and 19-year-old son. Her son Georgi studies at Yerevan State University Architecture and Construction, in the department of technology management. 
Both Emma and her husband work hard to sustain their family, but it is very difficult for them to save money for Georgi's education. So Emma has applied for this loan to pay for her son's university tuition. 
The loan is very important to Emma and her son, to permit him to complete his education and find a well-paid job.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is a 20-year-old, proactive, young lady. She studies at Armenian State Pedagogical University, in the department of culture. Anna lives with her mother, who works in a greenhouse. Unfortunately, the mother's salary doesn't allow her to pay Anna's tuition. So Anna has applied for this loan to pay her university tuition. This loan will help Anna to complete her education and become a good specialist. She dreams of finding a well-paid job and ensuring a better future for her mother.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik lives in Yerevan with her husband, son, mother and father. She runs a little shop, where she buys and sells food. Her mother and father receive retirement pensions.  
Hasmik's husband helps her with the shop, and they work hard to achieve good sales and sustain their family. Due to their friendly attitude and high-quality service, Hasmik and her husband have gained many loyal clients during their year of running the shop.
Now Hasmik needs financial support to purchase supplies for her shop, in order to meet their clients' demand. That is the reason she has requested this loan. 
The loan is very important for Hasmik, in order to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for food supplies for her shop.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en: Nino is a 58-year-old widow who lives alone in the Sighnaghi district. Several times, Nino has requested loans from local financial institutions for her trading business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected each time because of her low income and poor living conditions. The only source of income for her is the small monthly income she earns by working as a cleaner locally. Nino has requested a loan from Credo to start a clothing sales business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits on reasonable terms for the country's rural poor who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low income. Nino will purchase clothes in the capital city at wholesale prices and resell them in her village for a profit. It will be hard work for Nino but, according to estimates, her business will be profitable and will increase her income. The increased profit will be reinvested in her clothing trading business to increase her stock and sales volume. Nino will be able to increase her spending to satisfy her daily needs and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for her start-up business.

loans.name: Lernik

texts.en:
Lernik lives in a small village in the Masis region with his wife and son. Lernik has six mother pigs and 45 piglets. Together with his wife, Lernik also grows peaches, pears, apples, apricots and plums. He is a very hardworking person and does his best in order to get good harvests and improve his family's living conditions.
But, unfortunately, his barn is very old and needs to be renovated. So Lernik has applied for this loan to renovate the barn. This will help him to increase his livestock and grow his income.
With the help of this loan, Lernik will also purchase forage for his livestock.
The loan is very important for Lernik to renovate the barn and increase his income.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of his barn and buy forage for his livestock.

loans.name: Adib

texts.en:
Adib is 23 years old and married. He has completed secondary school and is the father of two children.  He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has worked very hard for many years to get his family ahead and give them everything they deserve. He has a gas cylinder store which is his main source of income. He started his business with limited capital that he had managed well. His business is located in a very strategic area. Many people prefer his store because he provides the best possible customer service.

Adib's dream is to see his store flourish. Due to the current bad situation in Yemen, he has less profit from his enterprise. So, he took out a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to stock his business with more gas cylinders  so that his customers will always find what they need and keep coming back. His goal for the future is for his business to grow and to have more customer demand. He will then get more income, which will help meet the basic needs of his household.

loans.use: to stock his business with more gas cylinders

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine lives in Sariar village and is a mother of five children. Together with her husband, Lusine is involved in agriculture. They keep five cows, 35 chickens and cultivate potatoes.  They do their best in order to gather a good harvest and cover family's basic costs. But it is very difficult for them to cover their family’s basic costs. 

So Lusine has requested this loan to purchase four calves and forage for feeding them. She plans to raise and fatten them during the winter and sell them at a higher price. This will help Lusine and her husband increase their income and provide better living conditions for their children.

loans.use: to pay for four calves and forage for feeding them

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is 51 years old. She lives in a small village of Kaspi district with her mother, who is provided with a retirement pension. Ketevan is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has a milk cow, whose milk is used in dairy products. Besides that, she has agricultural land, where apple trees and potatoes are grown. She sells the harvested products with the dairy products locally in an open market at a good price.

 Ketevan is very hard-working woman and does her best to insure in a good harvest. She requested a loan to plow her land. After the land is prepared, she will be able to sow potato seeds. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income they will improve their living conditions. Ketevan awaits your support.

loans.use: to prepare her farmland for sowing potatoes

loans.name: Gantsetseg

texts.en: Gantsetseg, 36, lives with her husband and 3 children in a rental house in Bulgan Province, Mongolia. Her husband Batbayar works at private company as an assistant worker. Her daughter Sodgerel, 13, and son Togsbileg, 8, go to a local school. The borrower gave birth to her youngest child a year-and-a-half ago and has stayed home taking care of the newborn baby and family since. She is now planning to restart her bakery business. She attended a bakery course in 2007 and 2010. She worked as an assistant chef in another bakery before, and she has lot of experience in the business. She is now requesting 300,000 MNT to purchase a new stove to start her business. She is a hardworking, neat and well-experienced woman.

loans.use: to purchase a new stove to start a home bakery business.

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en:
Eldar is 51 years old and married with five children. Eldar has been breeding cattle for the past 15 years. After several attempts to find a job, he gave up and decided to start his business. With the help of his wife, they purchased their first cattle.

Eldar usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, then resells at a more a profitable price in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 90 AZN and this business is the only one source of financial income in his family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Eldar also keeps milking cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.  

He wants to expand his business and improve the living conditions of his family. He applied for a 1,600 AZN loan in order to purchase two cattle and one milking cow. This will be his third loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy two cattle and one milking cow.

loans.name: Asli

texts.en:
Asli is 42 years old and single. She is a market vendor and sells different kinds of goods, such as flour, beverages, macaroni, butter and candies. She also raises seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them in her shop as well. She has five years of experience and has deep knowledge of the market and demand of clients.
 
The food products that she sells are very popular among people and in high demand. Her monthly profit from selling food is 150 AZN. Her daughter helps to purchase products and brings them to the shop. This is solely the financial income in her family. She is a very successful entrepreneur because of good location, in the central bazaar of her home city.

Asli applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to purchase more food products and diversify the range of goods to cover customers' demand. This will be her second loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy more food products for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Parvana

texts.en:
Parvana is a 22-year-old single woman. She is a market vendor and sells different kinds of goods, such as flour, beverages, macaroni, butter and candies. She has three years of experience and has deep knowledge of the market and demand of clients. Her father helped her to start up the business and is always ready to give her advice because he is also a very experienced vendor. 

The food products she sells are very popular among people and in high demand. Her monthly profit from selling food is 170 AZN. Her husband helps to purchase products and brings them to the shop. This is solely the financial income in her family. She is a very successful entrepreneur because of good location, in the central bazaar of her  home city.

Parvana applied for a 1,000 AZN loan in order to purchase more food products and to diversify the range of goods to cover customers' demand.

loans.use: to buy more food products for resale.

loans.name: Cingiz

texts.en:
Cingiz is a 54-year-old man who is married with four children. He is a farmer and has been growing seasonal fruits and vegetables for the past six years. During these years, Cingiz gained enough skills and experience to run the business. He chose this crop business because it is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. 

People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes, such as pilau and dolma, are made with vegetables. Fresh fruits serve every table in an Azerbaijan family and also make fresh punch. Cingiz usually sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN.

As these products are in high demand, Cingiz wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.  This will be his third loan and Cingiz has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Al_Eyman Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al_Eyman and consists of six women who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 280,000 YER from AMB. 

Arwa is 28 years old, married with four children, and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She is a tailor who works hard in order to provide for her family. She describes her business as offering great services for her family. 

Arwa owns a house and she applied for a youth loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies to use for her home.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use for her home.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en:
Anvar is 53 years old and married with five children. Anvar has been breeding cattle for the past 20 years. After several attempts to find a job, he gave up and decided to start his business. With the help of his brother, they purchased the first cattle.

Anvar usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, then resells at a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 180 AZN and this business is only one source of financial income for the family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes, such as pilau and dolma. Anvar also keeps milking cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.  

Anvar wants to expand his business and improve the living conditions of his family. He applied for a 2,000 AZN loan in order to purchase two cattle and two milking cows. This will be his third loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy two cattle and two milking cows.

loans.name: Alovsat

texts.en:
Alovsat is a 35-year-old man who runs a private business. He is a market vendor and his primary activity is selling food products. Alovsat sells different kind of goods, such as yogurt, sausages, candies, cookies and macaroni for the past 20 years. He is responsible for his wife and three children. 

His business brings him a stable income of 100 AZN and his spouse helps to sell products from the shop. Alovsat would like to increase his income and for this purpose he applied for 1,500 AZN. He will use this loan to diversify and purchase more products for his shop. This will be his third loan and he has a good loan history.

loans.use: to buy more food products for resale.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is 55 years old, and married with three children. She is a market vendor and sells different kinds of goods, such as flour, beverages, macaroni, butter and candies. She has 20 years of experience and has deep knowledge of the market and demand of clients. 

The food products she sells are very popular among people and in high demand. Her monthly profit from selling food is 120 AZN. Her husband helps to purchase products and brings them to the shop. This is the sole financial income for Rahila's family. She is a very successful entrepreneur because of good location, in the central bazaar of her  home city.

Rahila applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to purchase more food products and to diversify the range of goods to cover customers' demand. This will be her second loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy more food products for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for sewing and also for making handicrafts.

loans.name: Ilkin

texts.en:
Ilkin is 32 years old, married and has two children. He is a market vendor and sells different kinds of food products in the central bazaar. Ilkin has six years of experience in this field, which makes him a knowledgeable and skilled person.

He usually sells rice, macaroni, yogurt, ketchup, sugar and other items. Products he sells are in very high demand and people use them in everyday life.  Also these products are in very high demand among local people and his monthly profit is 180 AZN. His spouse helps him to update merchandise in his shop. 

This business is only one financial income in his family and Ilkin would like to increase his sales as well as cover market demand. For this purpose, he applied for 2,000 AZN.  He will use this loan to purchase more products.

loans.use: to buy more food products to increase monthly profit.

loans.name: Guloglan

texts.en:
Guloglan is a 47-year-old man who runs a private business. He is married and has two daughters. His primary activity is selling food products. He is a market vendor and has been selling different kinds of goods, such as yogurt, sausages, candies, cookies and macaroni, for the past 15 years. He is responsible for his parents and children. His spouse helps him to sell products. 

Guloglan's shop located in the central bazaar, which is why his products sell very quickly. His business brings him stable income of 120 AZN and his older son helps to sell products from the shop. Guloglan would like to increase his income, and for this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. He will use this loan to diversify and purchase more products for his shop.

loans.use: to buy more food products to cover customer demand.

loans.name: Ramin

texts.en:
Ramin is 32 years old and married with three children. Ramin has been breeding sheep for the past ten years. His pension was too small to cover the needs of his family and he decided to start his business. With the help of his wife, they purchased their first sheep.

Ramin usually buys lambs, raises and fattens them for 3-5 months and then resells them at a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 120 AZN and this business is only one source of financial income in his family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. 

Ramin wants to expand his business and improve the living conditions of his family. He applied for a 2,000 AZN loan in order to purchase 20 sheep and fodder (feed). This will be the fourth loan from AqroInvest CU and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy 20 sheep.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 32 years old. She is married and lives in the Kobuleti district with her husband and three children. The main income for Lolita is her newly started store, selling secondary furniture. It has been a profitable project, but it also needs more support to further develop. Several times, she has asked for loans from local financial institutions to develop her business, but without success. Her loan requests were rejected each time because of low income. 

Lolita’s loan request was approved as part of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-ups and re-startups with credit with soft conditions to the rural poor who do not have access to credit products, since they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Lolita will purchase more furniture that customers often request. She plans to increase the turnover in her trade business gradually. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Lolita will work hard, and she will be able to improve the living conditions for her family. With this loan, her family will generate enough income to access regular available credit products in the country’s capital market, in the event that they need it.

loans.use: to purchase more furniture for resale.

loans.name: La Victoria Group

texts.es:
El comité La Victoria  son todas de la zona de San Lorenzo  son 15 integrantes  muy responsables que se han esforzado por salir adelante y crecer, son un ejemplo de lucha y esfuerzo. Una de ellas es Angelica, que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado crecer.
Ella se dedica a la venta de helados, y cuenta que le está yendo muy bien, ya que tiene muy buena clientela, pues aquí hace mucho calor y tiene muy buena venta.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar más helados, ya que se acerca el tiempo en que más calor hace y quiere poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The 15 members of the “La Victoria” committee are from the San Lorenzo zone and they have all worked to get ahead and grow.  They are an example of effort and dedication.  Angelica is one of them and she has managed to grow through her effort.

She sells frozen treats and tells us that things are going well for her because she has good customers; the weather is hot and sales are good.

She is asking for this loan to buy more frozen treats, since the hottest time of the year is approaching and she wants to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy frozen treats.

loans.name: Renacer 2 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la cuidad de Encarnación surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la Fundación se encuentran  en el 1er ciclo, y tienen todo el entusiasmo para poder seguir trabajando y ayudando a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra Ana, ella tiene una despensa  bien surtida en su casa, y comenta que empezó con un pequeño negocio, pero que hoy en día y gracias a su trabajo esta saliendo adelante. Está casada con el señor Victorino  quien es Albañil, tienen 3 hijos,  y ellos son el motor de esta familia, por quienes ambos luchan para sacarlos adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar bebidas, verduras, panificados, y demás productos para poder tener bien surtido su negocio y ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This communal bank was started in the city of Encarnación through one of the member’s contact with Fundación Paraguaya. They are in their first loan cycle and are enthusiastic about being able to continue working and helping their families. 

Sra. Ana is one of the members of the group. She has a well stocked store in her house and notes that she began with a small business but that today, thanks to her hard work, she is getting ahead. She is married to Sr. Victorino, who is a mason, and they have three children, who are the motivating force of this family. She and her husband both work hard to help their children succeed.

Ana is requesting this loan to purchase drinks, vegetables, baked goods and other items so that her business will be well stocked and she can offer a variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, vegetables, baked goods and other products.

loans.name: Virgen De Los Milagros Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres se llama “Virgen de los Milagros”. Las señoras son muy unidas, responsables y solidarias, cuentan que tienen muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante, tanto con el grupo y familiarmente.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Cinthia, quien trabaja en la venta de ropas. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y tiene muchas ansias de seguir creciendo en su negocio. Ella misma dice que la única forma de salir adelante es trabajando y luchando por lo que uno quiere.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de ropas, con lo que tendrá más variedad y  podrá seguir trabajando. Este grupo agradece por la ayuda que recibe, ya que les permite ayudar a sus familias.
texts.en:
The “Virgen de los Milagros” committee is made up of some very united and responsible women.  They say that they have a great desire to work and get ahead, both with the group and with their families.

Cinthia is one of the ladies and she sells clothing.  She is a hardworking person with a great desire to continue growing her business.  She herself says that the only way to get ahead is to work hard for what she wants.

She is asking for this loan to buy clothing so that she will have a wider assortment and can continue working.  This group is grateful for the assistance they receive that allows them to help their families.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora    Julia quién  invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y así se formaron y decidieron trabajar juntas.
La Sra. Julia se dedica a la costura, esta casada con el señor Victor con quien tiene un hijo pequeño, y un próximo integrante de la familia, estan en la dulce espera de otro hijo. Ella solicito el crédito  para la compra de tela, hilo y  todo lo demás para la costura, ella trabaja en su casa en conjunto con su mama, trabajan para una fabrica, pero en su casa, ella espera algún día tener un negocio mas grande y mas personal para una mejor producción.
texts.en:
Julia invited and organized her friends to form the “Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras” and the members decided to work together.

Julia sews and is married to Victor.  They have a young son, the newest member of the family, and they are excitedly awaiting the arrival of another child.  She is asking for this loan in order to buy fabric, thread, and other sewing supplies.  She works from her home, along with her mother, and also in a factory.  She hopes to have a larger business in her home someday, along with employees to increase production.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and supplies.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Este es un grupo numeroso de la ciudad de Encarnación, tiene 28 miembros, ya que es un grupo muy numeroso es muy loable que todas ellas estén muy unidas y trabajen juntas, y gracias a su trabajo ya están en su cuarto ciclo. 
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra Mirtha, ella tiene su comedor, donde acuden muchas personas día a día para poder comer sus ricas comidas, ella está acompañada con el señor Ernesto, quien es Pintor, tienen dos hijos por quienes ella y su esposo se esfuerzan, para poder darles todo lo que necesitan.
Mirtha solicita de este crédito para la compra de carne, pollo, verduras, condimentos, panificados y demás productos para poder seguir haciendo las delicias con las que deleita a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This is a large group from the city of Encarnación.  It has twenty-eight members, so it's one of the biggest.  It's praiseworthy that they are all very close-knit and work together, and thanks to their work they're already on their fourth loan cycle.

One of the members is Mirtha.  She has an eatery where lots of people come every day for her yummy dishes.  She's joined by Ernesto, a painter, and together they have have two children to whom they strive to give everything they need.  

Mirtha is seeking this loan to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, condiments, baked goods and other items to continue making the delicacies that delight her clients.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, condiments, baked goods, etc.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina, tiene la edad  de 19 años, está soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la reparación en una parte de la casa ya que cuando llueve el agua se le mete adentro de la vivienda. Lo que pretende es aprovechar los precios bajos y ofertas en los materiales de construcción de buena calidad y hacer las reparaciones necesarias. Con las mejoras que pretende hacer quiere buscar una mejor estabilidad y bienestar para su familia y pasar un fin de año con más tranquilidad y comenzar el 2013 con mejores condiciones de vida y positivismo. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. No había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Karina is 19 years old, single, and lives with her parents and siblings who are her greatest priority.  She will use the money from this loan to repair part of her home because the water leaks in when it rains.  She wants to take advantage of the low prices and sales on good quality building materials to make the repairs.  With these repairs she is hoping for better stability and wellbeing for her family so that they can spend the New Year in peace and begin 2013 with better living conditions and hope.  This will be her first loan through FUDECOSUR.  She has not had any previous loans with other banks, but FUDECOSUR provided her a loan with no problems and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to make home repairs.

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.es: Alexandra, tiene la edad  de 24 años, está soltera, vive con su hijo y padres los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de unos terneros y la compra de semilla de pasto, además pagar mano de obra para la siembra. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de terneros. Además de poder comprar animales de buena calidad. Con el ingreso de la venta de los terneros que espera obtener y utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su hijo y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en la actividad. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Alexandra is 24 years old, single, and lives with her son and her parents; they are her highest priority.  She will use the money from this loan to buy some land and grass seed and also pay for farm labor.  She wants to take advantage of the good weather and soil and also put her years of experience at land management into practice.  She also wants to buy quality animals.  With the sale of the calves she expects to have, she will be able to provide for the wellbeing and education of her son and also meet with some family goals.  This will be her first loan through FUDECOSUR.  She has not had previous loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR provided a loan with simpler conditions and at a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to prepare her land and buy animals.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel, tiene la edad  de 29 años, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la reparación la reparación de cercas y la compra de semilla de pasto para tener potreros bien poblados de pasto y con un mejor rendimiento por área, además de comprar algunos terneros para el engorde. Lo que pretende es aprovechar los precios bajos en algunos animales y que son  de buena calidad. Con las mejoras realizadas en los potreros y la compra de nuevos terneros espera obtener más ingresos y así mejorar las condiciones de vida y tener una mayor superación personal y además de invertir más en la actividad y ser más competitivo y poder aprovechar las ventajas de las buenas condiciones de la propiedad para el desarrollo del ganado. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. No había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Manuel is 29 years old, single, and lives with his parents and siblings; they are her highest priority.  He will use the money from this loan to repair his fences and buy some grass seed so that he can have dense grassy pastures.  He will also buy some steer to fatten up.  He wants to take advantage of the low prices for some good quality animals.  With these repairs and animals, he expects to obtain greater income and in this way improve his quality of life, have personal success, and invest more into his business and be more competitive so that he can take advantage of the land’s and livestock’s good conditions.  This will be his first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He has not had previous loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR provided a loan with simpler conditions and at a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to prepare his land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make home repairs.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina sells peppers and also produces charcoal in Asebu near Cape Coast, which she has done for some years now. Faustina is married to a farmer and has 5 children. She uses her income to help her husband to feed the family and pay for her children’s school fees. Faustina will use her loan to purchase vegetables like peppers to sell and also firewood to produce charcoal to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Faustina will produce charcoal in large quantity.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables like peppers to sell and also firewood to produce charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en: Ernestina lives with her husband and 3 children at Asebu, near Cape Coast. She makes kenkey and charcoal to sell. In front of her is some of the charcoal she sells. She uses her income to support her husband in feeding and clothing their children. Ernestine will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal and  bags of maize to produce her kenkey to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ernestina will produce in larger quantities.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal and maize to produce her kenkey to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells locally made soap and saucepans at Asebu near Cape Coast. She has been in this business for 10 years now. She is a single parent and has four children. She uses her income to provide for her family. Ama will use her loan to purchase saucepans to sell and raw materials to produce her soap to sell. With the new profit, Ama will expand her business

loans.use: to purchase saucepans to sell and raw materials to produce soap

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en: Adwowa is a food vendor who cooks rice for sale. She serves it with fried fish and vegetable sauce at Asebu, near Cape Coast. She is married to a mason and has 4 children. Adwowa has been in this business for 3 years now. She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of their children. She will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and fish, which she will use to prepare her food for sale. She hopes to use the new profit from her expanded business to mount a better stall in which to sell her food.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and fish to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy sells saucepan, soap, and plastic bowls at Asebu near Cape Coast.  She is married to a farmer and has six children. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their accommodation bills. Mercy will use her loan to purchase saucepans, soaps, bags of rice and plastic bowls for resale.  With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase saucepans, soaps, rice and plastic bowls to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace operates a grocery business. She has done this for eight years now. The items in her grocery shop are caned tomatoes, canned beef, milo, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, and powdered milk. She is married with four children. Grace uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, Grace plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort lives with her husband and 5 children at Asebu, near Cape Coast. Comfort sells fruit, like oranges, and charcoal. She has done this for 3 years now. She is married, and her husband is a mason. She uses her income to support her husband in paying to feed and clothe their children. Comfort will use her loan to purchase a variety of fruit and bags of charcoal to sell. With the profits from her expanded business, Comfort will produce charcoal that she sells herself.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruit and bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua  lives together with her husband who is a farmer and their five children at Asebu near Caper Coast. Efua sells kenkey (a sour dough dumpling) and maize.  She has done this for some years now.  She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their home. Efua will use her loan to purchase bags of maize to sell and to produce her kenkey to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to sell and to produce her kenkey to sell.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Adwowa sells maize. She also cooks banku (cooked fermented corn dough) to sell at Asebu near Cape Coast. She serves her banku with fried fish and vegetable sauce. 

Adwowa is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a mason. She uses her income to assist her husband in the general up-keep of their home. 

Adwowa will use her loan to purchase more bags of maize for resale. She will also use some to cook her banku and to buy vegetables for her sauce to satisfy her customers. With the new profits, Adwowa wishes to mount a stall for the sale of her banku.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of maize for resale, to cook her banku, and to buy vegetables for her sauce.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina sells frozen beef, chicken, and fish at Asebu near Cape Coast, which she has done for 10 years now. She is married with 3 children. Her husband is a mechanic. Faustina uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their children. 

Faustina will use her loan to purchase frozen beef, chicken, and fish to sell. With the new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase frozen beef, chicken, and fish to sell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica  is a petty trader.  For the last three years, she has sold footwear, children's dresses,  ladies wear, underwear, bras and panties. She  lives at Asebu near Cape Coast.  Monica  is married and has two children.   She uses her income to support her husband in paying their accommodation bills. Monica will use her loan to purchase footwear, children's dresses, underwear and ladies wear for resale. With the new profit from her expanded business she wish to build a shop to enable her to sell the dresses .

loans.use: to purchase footwear, children's dresses, underwear and ladies wear for resale.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en: For the last 15 years, Adwowa has produced palm kernel oil for sale at  Asebu near Cape Coast.  Adwowa  is married  and has three children.  Adwowa  uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their children.  Adwowa  will use her loan to purchase palm fruit  and kernels to produce  her palm kernel oil for sale.  With the new profit,  Adwowa will buy a machine for the production of her palm  kernel oil.

loans.use: to purchase palm fruit and kernel  to produce  her palm  kernel oil for sale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua lives with her husband and 2 children at Asebu, near Cape Coast. Efua sells bags of rice, tiger nuts, sweet potatoes, and charcoal, which she has done for 6 years now. She is married and her husband is a photographer. She uses her income to support her husband and to feed and clothe their  children. 

Efua will use her loan to purchase bags of rice, oil, tiger nuts, sweet potatoes, and charcoal to sell. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua will produce the charcoal she sells herself.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, oil, tiger nuts, sweet potatoes, and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua  sells saucepans and charcoal at Asebu near Cape Coast. She has done this for the last two years.  Efua is married and her husband is a farmer.  She uses her income  to support her husband to pay their accommodation bills.  Efua  will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal and saucepans to sell.  With the new profit from her expanded business, Efua will produce the charcoal she sells herself .

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal and saucepans to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is married and has three children. She has received schooling through middle school. 

Ekua sells liquid soap in Kokoado in Elmina, which she has done for eight years. Her husband is a driver. Ekua uses her income to assist her husband in the upbringing of their children. 

Ekua will use the loan to purchase raw materials to produce her liquid soap for sale. With the new profits, Ekua plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to produce her liquid soap for sale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama sells banku (a ghanaian dish) and fish at Kokoado in Elmina. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a pensioner.

Ama has been selling banku and fish for the past fifteen years. She is responsible for assisting her husband in paying utility bills. 

Her loan will be used to buy maize and fish. She hopes to use the profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy maize and fish for her business.

loans.name: Mathilda

texts.en:
Mathilda is single and has two children. Mathilda is a baker; she bakes bread for sale in Kokoado in Elmina, which she has done for five years. Mathilda uses her income to pay for her children's school fees. 

Mathilda will use the loan to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil to bake her bread to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mathilda plans to educate her children through to the college level.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua sells ladies' and children's wear, underwear and cosmetics at Elmina. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. 

Ekua has been selling cosmetics for three years. She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their family. Ekua will use her loan to purchase ladies' and children's clothes and more cosmetics for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business to acquire a shop for the sale of the cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase ladies' and children's clothes and more cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth Nkrumah produces liquid soap for sale at Elmina, as she has for six years. Elizabeth is married to a businessman and has two children.  She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their family. She will use her loan proceeds to purchase chemicals and other raw materials for the production of liquid soap.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and other raw materials for the production of liquid soap.

loans.name: Agnas

texts.en: For some years now, Agnas has sold doughnuts and also produced palm kernel oil for sale at  Asebu near Cape Coast.  Agnas is married  and has one child.  Agnas  uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their child.  Agnas  will use her loan to purchase bags of flour, sugar and cooking oil for her doughnuts and also to buy palm fruit  and kernels  to produce her palm kernel oil for sale.  With the new profit,  Agnas will buy a machine for the production of her palm  kernel oil for sale.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar and cooking oil to produce her doughnuts and also buy palm fruit and kernels  to produce her palm  kernel oil for sale.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi  is married and has three children. Esi has been selling African print cloth, earrings and cosmetics for the past 12 years at Kokoado in Elmina, Her husband is a farmer. Esi uses her income to assist her husband in educating their children. Esi will use the loan to purchase African print earrings and costmetics. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to build a shop for her business

loans.use: purchase African print earrings and cosmetics.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis vive con su esposa y con su hijo menor de edad, con esfuerzo la vivienda donde vive es alquilada cada mes paga cierta cantidad por vivir en ese lugar. Es un hombre muy responsable con lo que le corresponde hacer y siempre con la visión de que es cabeza de hogar y el responsable de llevar el sustento diario. Desde hace ya 5 años se ha dedicado a la agricultura antes ha trabajado con sus padres y hace poco tiempo se independizo alquila su propia parcela de tierra para tener sus propios cultivos y de estos vende cierta parte y es así como se gana la vida aparte que cuando no hay suficiente cosechas trabaja como jornal para subsistir más el día a día.  Luis ha decidido solicitar a INTEGRAL un préstamo para comprar insumos básicos como: Semillas, Abonos, Fertilizantes y  también pagar mano de obra para comercializar lo que cosecha que es maicillo espera contar con la ayuda y agradece a Dios porque nunca lo ha dejado solo y le ha sabido brindar un buen futuro a su familia.
texts.en: Luis lives with his wife and young son in a rented home.  Each month he pays a set rent.  He is very responsible with what he does; always thinking about the fact that he is the head of the household and responsible for his family’s daily support.  He has been a farmer for the past five years and had worked with his parents, but recently decided to venture out on his own and rents his own parcel so that he can have his own crops.  He sells part of them and earns a living in this way.  Aside from this, he works as a field hand whenever he doesn’t have enough of a harvest.  Luis has decided to approach INTEGRAL for a loan to buy basic supplies, like seeds and fertilizers, and pay for labor so that he can sell his harvest.  He hopes for assistance and is very grateful to God because he has never left him alone and has provided a good future for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Gerardo Antonio

texts.es: Gerardo de 28  años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa  y su hija. Él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace muchos años. Cada año realiza la siembra de los principales granos básicos como maíz, frijoles y sorgo. Dicha actividad la repite año con año ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y lleva el pan de cada día a su hogar. Su sueño es mejorar  su calidad de vida  y la de su familia ya que viven en condiciones muy humildes y desea darles algo diferente.  Esto lo motiva a trabajar con más entusiasmo ya que solo con el trabajo logrará dar a su familia lo que tanto desea. Es por estas razones que ha tomado la decisión de acercarse  a esta institución, INTEGRAL,  para solicitar este crédito que le permita invertir en los insumos agrícolas como: semillas, abonos, insecticidas, u otros. Siente que son los necesarios para el cultivo de la tierra y continuar llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar. Espera lograr su objetivo de dar a su familia lo que se merece una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
