Rosefely is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 65 years old, is widowed and has one child. To make a living, Rosefely has operated a tailoring business for 23 years and earns 2,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2009, Rosefely joined GDMPC. Rosefely is requesting a loan of 2,800 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Karen

texts.ru:
Карен родился и живет  в селе Антарашат ,Сюникской области. Ему 41 лет , женат , имеет сына и дочь по 12 и 13 лет, которые учатся в сельской средней школе.  Карен живет со своей семьей и  с родителями пенсионерами.
 С 2000 года  Карен и его семья занимаются сельскохозяйством в селе Антарашат. В основном по хозяйству Карену  помогают жена и дети.
Карен имеет крупный рогатый скот, кур, имеет так же огород где  выращивает овощи и фрукты. 
У Карена есть еще собственная земля которая служит для пастбища. Карен за год реализует овощи , фрукты ,молоко яйца. Он имеет постоянных клиентов в городе Капане.  Карен  имеет также грузовую машину которую  использует для даставки урожая в Капан и  местные сельские рынки. У Карена тяжелая но прибыльная работа, которая позволяет ему достойно содержать семью. 
Карену нужен кредит на сумму 200,000 Арм. драмм для покупки сена для крупного рогатого скота на зиму .
texts.en:
Karen lives where he was born, in the village of Antarashat in the Siunikskaya district.  He is 41 years old and married.  He has a son and daughter (13 and 14 years old) who study in the village school.  Karen lives with his family and his retired parents.   

Since 2000, Karen and his family have been in the farming business in Antarashat village.  His wife and children help him with the business.  Karen keeps cattle and chickens, and he has a large garden where he grows fruits and vegetables.  He also owns land that he uses for pasture.  Over the course of a year, he sells vegetables, fruit, milk, and eggs.  He owns a commercial vehicle for taking his harvest to market in the nearby villages and in the city of Kapan, where he has regular customers.  His is very hard work, but it's profitable and it allows him to provide properly for his family.

Karen needs a loan of 200,000 Armenian dram (AMD) to buy his cattle hay for the winter.

loans.use: to buy his cattle hay for the winter

loans.name: Dona

texts.ru:
Дона проживает в районе Джиликул. Ему 65 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Дона занимается растениеводством. Он в основном сеет пшеницу. Этим видом деятельности Дона занимается с 1980 года. Также вот уже 7 лет он занимается животноводством. Дона разводит мелко - рогатый скот у себя дома. 
Дона берет кредит для закупа овец и семян, чтобы увеличить поголовья скота и посеять пшеницу.
texts.en:
Dona lives in the Jilikul region.  He is 65 years old and married with three children.  Dona is a farmer and he primarily grows wheat.  He has been in this business since 1980.  He has also been in the livestock business for seven years already.  He raises sheep and goats at his home.  

Dona is taking out this loan to buy sheep and seed to increase the size of his herd and to plant wheat.

loans.use: to buy sheep and wheat seed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy citrus fruits

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en: Rosela, of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, has been in the business of selling fish for more than 7 years and earns about 3,000 PHP per month. She’s 32 years old now, yet continues to hang on in her fish-selling business to provide adequately for her 4 children. She's been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In order to enhance her business, she is borrowing 5,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to purchase more fish to sell. She hopes that someday her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 28-year-old married man who has been working as a barber for more than 14 years. Husein didn't finish his Intermediate education because of his parents' financial situation. He had to start working early to make his own living and cover his expenses.

Husein is applying for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to renew his shop's tools, machines and furniture that he established in 2004. He is a hard worker with a good reputation. This is his second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, with a good standing in his paying back history. His previous loan was invested in improving the shop's decorations and doing necessary maintenance, which resulted in a very impressive impact on customers.

He hopes to expand his working areas in the future, through meeting customers' needs and developing a special facial department.

loans.use: To renew his shop's tools, machines and furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is from Militar, Tukuran. She is 42 years old, is married and has four children. To make a living, Ma. Theresa  manages a fish vending business while her husband does the  fishing. She has been in her business for five years and earns PHP 5,000 a month from these activities. 

Recently, Ma. Theresa joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Atef

texts.en:
Atef is a 28-year-old single man who lives in Hodeidah, Yemen. He only completed secondary school. He has been operating a bike spare parts shop that has been running for many years. It is the only source of income for the family. He has worked very hard to get ahead in his life. He started his business by repairing motorbikes, and then he started to establish his business and improve his living conditions. 

He has attracted more customers because his business is located in a strategic area and because of the strength of mind which he has enjoyed. Due to the current bad situation in Yemen, he has less profit from his enterprise, and so he took out a youth loan of 150,000 YER from AMB in order to supply his business with more spare parts and keep his customers coming back.

loans.use: to buy bike spare parts for his business.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie is 47 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. Tessie runs a retail store at home. She has been in business for 11 years and earns about 3,000 PHP a month from store operations. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to buy items such as milk, diapers, food products, etc. She joined the GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Tessie hopes to obtain a good return from this investment and acquire enough revolving funds for the business.

loans.use: to buy items such as milks, diapers, food products, etc.

loans.name: Fatema

texts.en:
Fatema is a 52-year-old woman; she is married and the mother to seven sons and one daughter. Some of her sons are employed while others are still school students. Fatema lives in a small village where the population is famous for agriculture and raising livestock .

For the past eight years, Fatema and her husband have been raising and selling sheep and sheep products. This has been a profitable project but they also need more support to cover the family's needs.

Fatema is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing more sheep and more fodder to feed the sheep that she is raising. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

Fatema is photographed with the herd among which are the sheep that she is raising.

loans.use: To buy more sheep and additional fodder to feed the sheep

loans.name: Ma. Grezil

texts.en:
Ma. Grezil, a 39-year-old married mother of four children, lives in Militar, Tukuran. She has been operating a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community for seven years, earning 3,200 PHP a month. 

Having joined GDMPC this year, Ma. Grezil is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy items such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, soap and toothpaste. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy items such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, soap and toothpaste.

loans.name: Ser-Od

texts.en:
Ser-Od is 49 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in a ger (traditional Mongolian tent) in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband, Tuvshinbayar, has worked 32 years at the Mongolian railway company and has just retired. Her son, Monhbat, studies at the university, and her daughter runs her small business in town. 

Ser-Od has been running her business of a small grocery store on their spare land. She is now asking for a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to cover her son's university tuition and dormitory fees. She and her family members are all hardworking and neat people.

loans.use: to cover her son's university tuition and dormitory fees.

loans.name: Gunkeshari

texts.en:
Gun Keshari is 40 years old. She is married and has 2 children, aged 12 and 13. In 2010, she established her tea shop business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent loan to buy food supplies for her business. In the future, she plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal. Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.

loans.use: to buy food supplies.

loans.name: Progress Group

texts.en:
Progress Group is comprised of seven members, all from Teshie. They are Ashorkor, Joyce, Mercy, Mary, Ayorkor, Grace and Eunice, who sell maize (corn), fish, sewing accessories, prepared kenkey (cooked corn paste) and fish meals, cassava, and fruits. They have been together for five months.

Ayorkor is a 45-year-old fish seller, married to Daniel, a 52-year-old carpenter. They have two children, who are adults now and do not depend on their parents. Ayorkor needs GHS 800 to buy more fish to sell to her customers, which will support her husband. This is her fourth loan cycle with ID-Ghana.

She has been in this business for the past six years and was given a loan amount of GHS 300 at her first loan cycle. 

The entire group is borrowing an amount totaling GHS 4,650 to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: To buy two boxes of fish, for sale to customers.

loans.name: Sanu Maiya

texts.en:
Sanu Maiya is 49 years old. She is married and has 2 children, ages 22 and 20. Many years ago, she established her tea shop business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy food supplies for her business.  In the future, Sanu Maiya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal. Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.

loans.use: to buy food supplies.

loans.name: Mayis

texts.en:
Mayis is 48 years old and lives in Vanadzor city. He lives with his pensioner mother, his wife and two daughters. Mayis has a high pedagogical education and for more than 15 years has worked as a sports teacher in Vanadzor secondary schools. Because his teacher’s salary is low, he decided to run his own business in Vanadzor. 

More than one year ago Mayis started a pastry trading activity in the Lori area. He buys candies and cakes from wholesale markets, delivering and reselling it to food shops with his own car. With the profit from his business, Mayis is able to solve his family's needs and take care of his family better than some years ago. He would be very thankful to Kiva lenders if they lent him 500,000 AMD for increasing his merchandise assortment.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise assortment.

loans.name: Emma Georgette

texts.fr: Emma est une femme de 54 ans, célibataire et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la place depuis 30 ans où elle commercialise l'huile raffinée et l'huile de palme. c'est une activité qui ne rapporte pas quand on achète en détail, le bénéfice est vraiment minime et les ruptures de stocks sont permanente parce qu'elle est obligé faire écouler tout son petit stock pour pouvoir se réapprovisionner, les frais de transport sont élevés d'où son envie de faire le gros, en achetant plusieurs bidons d'huile. ce qui limitera ses ruptures de stocks,réduira son coût de transport des marchandises, augmentera son capital, ses ventes et donc son bénéfice. Elle ne sera plus obligé de tout vendre avant de pouvoir se réapprovisionner. Elle réinvestissera le bénéfice que lui apportera ce crédit dans son activité pour devenir grossiste plus tard.
texts.en: Emma Georgette is a 54-year-old woman who is married and the mother of three children. She has been selling refined oil and palm oil at a local market for 30 years. It is not a profit-making business when supplies are bought retail; profits are minimal and stock shortages constant because she is forced to use up all of her stock before being able to get new supplies, and the transport costs are high. Therefore, she would like to buy several cans of oil wholesale. This would allow her to minimise stock shortages and would reduce her transport costs, as well as increasing her capital, her sales and thus her profits. She would no longer be forced to sell everything before being able to resupply. She plans to reinvest the profits she earns thanks to this loan into her business, so that she can later become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy cans of oil for resale.

loans.name: Beche

texts.fr: Beche est un homme de 46 ans marié père de 4 enfants. Après sa formation, il a ouvert un petit atelier de couture qui fonctionne bien depuis 9 ans déjà, il fait aussi la broderie et le surfilage mais n'a pas tout le matériel pour aller plus vite avec ses commandes et pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle à temps. C'est pour celà qu'il sollicite un crédit pour s'acheter deux machines( une à coudre et l'autre pour le surfilage. ce qui l'évitera d'aller au marché tout le temps, il pourra coudre et revendre à ses clients. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit lui permettra non seulement de s'acheter son petit matériel de couture pour agrandir son activité, mais aussi de satisfaire certains de ses besoins ainsi que ceux de sa petite famille.
texts.en: Beche is a 46 year old man who is married and father to 4 children. Upon completing his training, he opened a small sewing workshop that has been doing good business for the past 9 years. He also does embroidery and edging but he doesn't have the material needed to work fast enough that he can keep up with his orders and satisfy his customers. This is why he is requesting a loan to buy two machines (a sewing machine and a finishing machine). This will enable him to avoid going to the market all the time, since he will be able to sew and resell to his customers. In addition to buying small sewing equipment, he will use the profit generated by his loan to take care of some of his needs as well as those of his family.

loans.use: To buy 2 used sewing machines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy mobile phones and accessories for his mobile shop business.

loans.name: Padma Laxmi

texts.en:
Padma Laxmi is 42 years old. She is married and has 2 children, age 25 and 22. In 2000, she established her business of making religious statues. Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent to buy raw materials for her business. In the future, Padma Laxmi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.   

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts. Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity. Terracotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills. Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing. In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone. With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume. This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing their profit margin.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Bratislav

texts.en:
Bratislav is a taxi driver. He lives with his wife and one child in a minority community, and he works hard to support his family. Due to a lack of family income, he chose to work as a taxi driver because it is the only source of work which allows him to earn enough income to meet the family’s expenses. He believes he does well in his job. He is very responsible when he drives. 

Bratislav is charismatic and has good relationships with his customers, and he has a good reputation in the community. Recently his van broke down and he was unable to work and generate income. He is requesting a loan to pay the costs of repairing his van, the labor needed and to buy engine spare parts. The loan will help him continue to generate income. He hopes in the future to buy a larger vehicle. Bratislav is grateful to all Kiva lenders and will continue to work hard to grow his business.

loans.use: to pay the costs of repairing his van, the labor needed and to buy engine spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy leather and shoelaces for her husband's shoe making business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 30-year-old single man who opened his own grocery store in 2008 to improve his living. He used to have a cash van that he used to work on and distribute his goods among neighboring villages.

He is always thinking of improving his living and increasing his income through different businesses. He is applying for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to start an additional business, and to support his own grocery store with the amount left. He will open an entertainment hall, where he will put a pool table, and also buy baby food (for his grocery store) requested by almost all of his customers and villagers.

Ibrahim is a hard worker, putting so much effort on improving both his businesses, and his social living. He hopes that the new business will improve the existing one, through the increased requests that will take place on the soft drinks, chips and many other sweets and chocolates, since he is planning to have the businesses stuck to each other to manage both in a very well managed way.

loans.use: To start an additional business and to support his own grocery store with the amount left.

loans.name: Ehab

texts.en:
Ehab is a 29-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and a 3-year-old kid in Rafah. He gets a low salary from his job and this income barely covers the family's needs. He would like to buy a water filter to make sure that his family will drink clean water. He took a 500 USD loan from FATEN to buy a water filter. This loan will help him to improve the living standards of his family. 

Ehab appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water filter for home use.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Couturière de profession, Ablavi est mariée à un éleveur et ils ont 03enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Elle emploie 15apprentis et exerce son activité à domicile. Afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, elle sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des machines à coudre.  Dans l’avenir, elle veut avoir une boutique de prêt à porter, agrandir son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Ablavi is a professional seamstress, married to a breeder.  They have three children who all attend school.  She employs fifteen apprentices and works from home.

In order to better meet her customers' needs, she is requesting a first loan from WAGES.  This loan will be used to buy sewing machines. 

In the future, Ablavi would like to open a shop where she will sell ready-to-wear clothing.  She would also like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines.

loans.name: Mikhail

texts.ru:
Михаил проживает в районе Кумсангир. Ему 32 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Михаил занимается животноводством. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Также еще Михаил занимается растениеводством. Он выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры для продажи. В этой области Михаил пять лет. 
Михаил берет кредит для закупа бычков с целью увеличения поголовья скота.
texts.en: Mikhail lives in the Qumsangir region of Tajikistan. He is 32 years old, married, and has 3 children. Mikhail raises livestock and earns a living by breeding cattle. Additionally, he cultivates crops for sale. He has been engaged in this activity for five years. Mikhail is taking this loan to purchase calves in order to expand his herd.

loans.use: to purchase calves in order to expand his herd

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 24-year-old married man. Although he is still young, he is a hard worker and looks to improve his family's standard of living. Ahmad is employed, and he also owns a business selling electrical goods like refrigerators and ovens. This project has been a profitable one and a good second source of income to Ahmad, but it needs more support to cover some costs.

Ahmad took a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN. Ahmad will use this loan to buy more goods for his store. 

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more electrical goods to sell.

loans.name: Doskal

texts.ru:
Доскал жительница района Кумсангир. Ей 44 года. Она живет с мужем. У нее четверо детей. Доскал имеет среднее образование. Она занимается домашним хозяйством. 
Доскал берет кредит для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы заняться животноводством. Сейчас когда есть возможность она намерена заняться своим бизнесом.
texts.en:
Doskal lives in the Qumsangir region of Tajikistan. She is 44 years old and lives with her husband and their four children. Doskal has secondary education. Currently, she is taking care of the family's household.

Doskal is taking this loan to purchase cattle. She wants to use this opportunity to launch her own livestock business.

loans.use: to purchase cows and a calf

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is pictured inside his store.

Raed is a 25-year-old single young man. For the past four years, he has been operating a mobile phone store, selling different types of mobile phones and accessories to customers. His project is well known in the market and has a lot of loyal customers. It has been profitable and is the only source of income for Raed, but it needs more liquidity to cover some necessary costs.

Raed is requesting a shariah-compliant Murabaha loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a new collection of mobile phones and accessories. This will attract more new customers and satisfy his loyal ones, increasing his sales and improving his income.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Arshaluys

texts.en:
Arshaluys is 59 years old and lives with his wife in Vanadzor city. He has a high education in engineering. For a long time, Arshaluys worked in the construction sphere, but as because of the  low salary he decided to change his job.

For about 8 years, Arshaluys has been engaged in the trade of gold jewelry. He buys gold jewelry from Yerevan's wholesale gold markets and resells it in his rented stall in Vanadzor Gold Market. 

Arshaluys has a son who lives and works in the Russian Federation with his wife and newborn son. Arshaluys's son often helps his parents in Armenia to relieve his parents monthly expenses.

Arshaluys’s new activity lets him to supply his family's needs much better than the last one in construction. 

Arshaluys is asking for a loan of 3,000 USD from Kiva to increase his jewelry inventory. The new loan will help Arshaluys to develop his business.

loans.use: to increase his jewelry inventory to resell.

loans.name: Henalisha

texts.en:
Henalisha is engaged in the activity of selling milk and milk products in her house. She has two cows in her herd. She has been involved in this activity for the past few years. She sells 9 litres of milk daily at the rate of 20 INR per litre. 

Henalisha is a 30-year-old differently-able lady living with her parents in a village named Jajpur of Odisha, India. She does not want to be a burden on her father so she started to sell milk in her house and assists her father financially.

Henalisha has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR for purchasing more cows. She says that doing so will let her increase her customers and then she can supply milk in large amounts. She also wants to repair the cattle shed.

She has a dream to give a better living standard to her family and save some money for future misfortunes.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing more cows and renovate the cattle shed.

loans.name: Swopneswar

texts.en:
Swopneswar is 20 years old, a differently-able person. He lives with his parents. He earns 4,000 INR per month from his betel shop. He sells betel, biscuits, detergents, wafers, incense sticks, face cream, etc. in his betel shop. But he needs to go to the market to bring the goods when required. He does not have enough funds to have these goods in bulk amount in stock. As a physically challenged person, it is difficult for him to go to the market very frequently and because of that, he is not able to meet the customers' demand. He wants to purchase the above goods and some other additional products like chocolates, talcum powder, soaps, shampoos, etc. in bulk to meet his customers' demand.

He request a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase the above products in bulk. He has a dream to grow his business so that he can meet the customers' demand and save some money for his future.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing betel, biscuits, detergents, wafers, incense sticks, face cream, etc. for his 'betel cum variety' shop.

loans.name: Ushuhuda Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mishonya  est entrepreneur, vice présidente du groupe Ushuhuda, âgée de  plus de 60 ans, mariée, mère de 5 enfants. Son conjoint est un chargé de crédit dans une coopérative de la place. Elle fait le petit commerce de divers (riz, plastics, souliers, etc.) au petit marché de Katindo II. Aussitôt, elle a fait le mariage, environs 35 ans, elle commença son business avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Vers 2008, elle bénéficia de premier crédit de l’IMF Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec des nouveaux produits (1 sac de riz, dizaines des plastics, 10 paires souliers, etc.), car elle pourra profiter de cette période de festivité pour vendre. En plus, elle ambitionne construire une maison pour ses jeunes enfants et les faire scolariser. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique.Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en: The client named Mishonya is a businesswoman, she is vice-president of the Ushuhuda group, over 60 years old and married with five children. Her husband is a credit manager in a local cooperative. She has a small business where she sells various items (rice, plastics, shoes, etc.) at the little market in Katindo II. As soon as she was married, about 35 years ago, she started up her business with her own funds received from her husband. In about 2008, she was awarded a first loan from IMF Hekima. This new loan will enable her to stock up on new products (1 bag of rice, dozens of plastics, ten pairs of shoes, etc.) for she will be able to take advantage of the festive season to sell them. In addition, she plans to build a house for her younger children and to send them to school. The client thanks Hekima for its action in favour of poor people who are excluded from traditional banks. It should be noted that some clients are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to buy new products (1 bag of rice, 10 pairs of shoes, etc).

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Jayanta Ku

texts.en:
Jayanta Ku is a physically challenged person, aged 30. He lives with his parents, wife and his two children who are in school. He owns and manages a variety shop where he sells betel, packaged food (like biscuits, cake, etc.), soap of different brands, detergent, shampoo and personal care products (like talcum powder, face wash, body lotion, etc.)  Because there is only one variety shop in his village, all the villagers are depending on his shop, but he cannot meet the customers' demand.

He requested a loan of 25,000 INR to purchase more stock of the products he sells now.  And he wants to add some new varieties of products like cooking oil, lentils, noodles, etc. He hopes to give a better standard of living to his family and provide better education for his children.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing betel, packaged food, soaps, detergents, shampoo and personal care products for his variety shop.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George lives in Sighnaghi District, East Georgia, with his wife and 17-year-old son. The family is involved in an agricultural business. George owns a vineyard and a plot of land where he grows peppers. The harvested products are sold at the local open market.

George has requested a loan to start his trading business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

George will use this loan to purchase a car and to start the business. He will purchase fruits and vegetables from farmers at wholesale prices and sell them in nearby towns. The family's income will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions. Along with the above mentioned, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a car and to start his business

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou est une femme mariée. Elle est mère de deux enfants dont une fille qui fréquente l'école primaire.Elle pratique un commerce de produits cosmétique dans une cantine au marché de sa localité.Ce commerce lui permet de subvenir à certains de leur besoins ainsi qu'à prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de ses enfants. Afin de renforcer son activité, elle sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acheter des produits cosmétiques. Son ambition est de faire des voyages de commerce dans les pays de la sous - région.
texts.en: Fatou is married. She has two children including a daughter who goes to primary school. She has a small business selling cosmetics in a canteen at her local market. This activity enables her to provide for some of the family's needs and to cover her children's expenses. In order to enhance her business, she requests a loan of 250000f to purchase cosmetic products. Her ambition is to be a travelling saleswoman in and around her sub-region.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Tamazi

texts.en:
Tamazi, 32 years old, lives in the Kvareli District with his wife, Nato, and his infant daughter. Tamazi has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but has had no success. His loan requests were always rejected because of low income and lack of experience in the new business, requirements usually demanded by local credit providers.

The family's main source of income is Tamazi's small earnings, working as a dentist in the nearby village. The family also owns a vineyard and sells grapes seasonally. Tamazi requested a loan from Credo to re-start the family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

Tamazi will use this loan to purchase 50 sheep. The family will breed sheep and sell cheese and lambs at a good price, thereby increasing their income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia, 22 years old, lives with her husband and son in a small village in the Kobuleti district, West Georgia. Natia is involved in an agricultural business. She has 70 bee hives with bee colonies and 2.5 hectares of agricultural land, where she grows tangerine and lemon trees. Natia sells the harvested products and honey locally at an open market for a good price. She is a very hardworking woman and does her best to ensure a good harvest.

Natia has requested a loan to purchase 10 bee hives with colonies to enable her to produce and sell more honey. This will increase the family's income, which will allow Natia to improve the family's living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase bee hives with bee colonies

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita is a 37-year-old lady staying with her parents and younger brother. She started a mobile business 10 years ago where she sells cooking oil, salt, spices, lentils, rice, snacks made of lentils, and other grocery items. She sells her products in the weekly markets which are organized in the villages near her village. She started this business to assist her father financially and to manage the family requirements. In this way she earns 3,000 INR per month, which is not sufficient to support her family. She wants to grow her business by purchasing more quantity of what she sells, so that she can easily satisfy her customers' demand.

Sabita has requested a loan of 30,000 INR to purchase goods in bulk amount and add some new varieties of stationery items and snacks to her shop.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing cooking oil, salt, spices, lentils, rice and other grocery items for her business.

loans.name: Johnis

texts.es: Johnis con su credikiva logró responde los pedidos de sus clientes de ropa, calzado en todas las líneas; sus consumidores estuvieron muy satisfechos y han solicitado para las fiestas familiares de fin de año vestidos elegantes, calzado y accesorios femeninos, para una vez mas lucir bien vestidos y disfrutar las navidades y el año nuevo con mucha alegría. Esta es la razón por la cual acude aun credikiva nuevamente, pues ante la demanda, el capital de trabajo de Johnis se torna insuficiente para responderles. Ella pide a sus financiadores que sigan apoyando a los empresarios de negocios pequeños en Colombia para ayudar a disminuir el porcentaje de pobreza y cumplir los sueños de muchas personas.
texts.en:
With his Kiva loan Johnis fulfilled his customers' requests for all lines of clothing and footwear.  His buyers were very satisfied and they have requested elegant clothes, shoes, and women's accessories for the end-of-the-year family holidays so they can be well dressed and happily enjoy Christmas and New Year.

This is why Johnis is requesting another Kiva loan, because he doesn't have enough working capital to respond to the demand.  He's asking his lenders to continue supporting small-business entrepreneurs in Colombia to help reduce the percentage of poverty and fulfill the dreams of a lot of people.

loans.use: to buy elegant clothes, shoes, and women's accessories

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr: Issa est un homme marié et père d'un enfant. Il vit dans une grande famille et participe ainsi à la prise en charge des dépenses d'alimentation, d'eau et d'électricité. Il tient une grande alimentation dans sa localité et les revenus tirés de cette activité lui permettent de faire face aux dépenses familiales. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce; il sollicite un pret de 200 000f pour acheter du lait, du savon en poudre et d'autres produits divers. Il ambitionne d'ouvrir une seconde alimentation.
texts.en: Issa is a married man with one child. He lives in a large family and participates in paying the costs for food, water, and electricity. He owns a big grocery in his neighbourhood and the income from this business enables him to cover the family expenses. In order to enhance his business; he requests a loan of 200 000 F to buy milk, soap powder and other products. He hopes to open a second grocery.

loans.use: to buy milk, soap powder and other products.

loans.name: Kausalya

texts.en:
Kausalya is a 40-year-old unmarried lady, living with her mother and her three sisters. She has a goat farm in which she presently has six goats. She purchases goat kids and sells them for meat to the local butcher shops when they grow. It takes 8-9 months for her to grow and sell them. She goes out in the morning to bring the goats to graze in the fields and returns by noon. She then helps her mother in the household activities and then resumes taking care of her goats by feeding them at home. Her sister assists her in maintaining the goats. In this way she is earning to control her cash flow, which is not sufficient to manage her daily activities.

She says that there is a lot of demand during the months of April to July and October to December, the auspicious time for Indian weddings. Currently she is not able to meet the demand during these months and other peak demand times. She wants to take a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase some more goat kids to be able to sell more and seize the opportunity during this peak demand period and to construct a shelter for the goats to protect them from the rain.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing goat kids and building a shelter for her goats.

loans.name: Umoja Kibaba Group

texts.fr: La cliente Basikungoma est leader du groupe d’affaire Umoja Kibaba. Elle est entrepreneur, âgé de 44 ans et mère de 12 enfants dont 5 étudient et les autres n’étudient pas faute de moyens financiers. Son mari est un mécanicien. La cliente est vendeuse de Fanta. Elle expose ses produits dans un petit kiosque. Elle commença cette micro entreprise depuis sa jeunesse. Plus tard, elle accéda aux crédits de Hekima. Actuellement, elle vient de réaliser 11 cycles dans le programme de microcrédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit lui permettre d’acheter 45 casiers de Fanta, qu’elle va écouler durant cette période de festivité de noël et de nouvel an. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle et y construire une maison. Le grand défi de son activité est qu’elle paye trop de taxes de l’administration publique. Malgré l’insécurité dans la ville de Goma, la cliente voit un futur meilleur. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en: Basikungoma is the leader of the Umoja Kibaba business group. She is a businesswoman aged 44 with 12 children of which five go to school and the others do not due to lack of financial means. Her husband is a mechanic. This client sells Fanta. She displays her products in a small kiosk. She started this business when she was young. Later on she gained access to Hekima loans. She has now received 11 loans from Hekima. This new loan will enable her to buy 45 crates of Fanta that she will sell during the period of festivities between Christmas and the New Year. She hopes to buy a plot of land and to build a house on it. The big difficulty in her business is that she pays too much in tax to the public administration services. In spite of the insecurity in Goma, the client is optimistic about the future. She thanks Hekima for its support for the owners of small businesses.

loans.use: to buy 45 crates of Fanta

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Angel Gregorio

texts.es:
ANGEL GREGORIO tiene 37 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive en casa de unos familiares en San José de chimbo provincia de Bolívar.

Angel Gregorio se dedica a la compra y venta de animales. Solicita el crédito para la compra cerdos, pollos, balanceado polbillo. Las compras las realizará en Guaranda. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los animales y la alimentación para poder criarlos para venderlos a un mejor precio.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el mal clima y las enfermedades de los animales.

El sueño es mejorar el nivel de vida. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar boli.
texts.en:
Angel Gregorio is 37, single, has no children, he lives with family in San Jose de chimbo, province of Bolivar. 

Angel Gregorio buys and sells livestock. He requests a loan to buy pigs, chickens and feed.  He will make the purchases in Guaranda.

With the help from the loan he will be able to buy the animals and the feed to be able to raise them and sell them at a better price.

The challenges he faces are bad weather and diseases of the livestock.

His dream is to increase his quality of live.  During his free time he likes to play volleyball.

loans.use: to buy pigs, chickens and feed.

loans.name: Soro Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe SORO YIRIWA sont essentiellement des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans,  en moyenne  5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Wayerma II un des quartiers populaire de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Assetou  fait le commerce  d’encens dans ce groupe de femmes elle est  assise au milieu. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt de la matière première pour la  fabrique de l’encens ; soit 30 kg de guéni, du parfums  du magnokisséni. Après fabrication, les ventes sont effectuées en détail sur place en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 47 500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The eight members of the SORO YIRIWA group are mainly married women of an average age of 40, with 5 children. They live mostly in monogamous families in Wayerma II which is one of the popular quarters of Sikasso.
This is their second loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution with the aim of satisfying their customers.
Assetou  sells incense in this group of women and she is sitting in the middle.
With her loan she plans to buy raw materials for the production of incense; that is 30 kg of guéni and magnokisséni perfume. After production, the incense is sold retail for cash through the family  to a mostly feminine clientele.
She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 47 500 FCFA part of which will be used to pay back her loan and the remainder will be saved.
Her ambition is to improve her turnover to satisfy her customers better.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making incense.

loans.name: El Remolino Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “El Remolino” está conformado por 21 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; feriante, venta de ropa, venta de juguetes, lencería, venta de verduras, venta de articulos para el hogar, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Quilicura, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Jacqueline, presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste una polera con colores blanco y negro, en su cabeza lleva unos lentes para el sol, y su pelo es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de bazar y paquetería, desde hace 2 años. Comenta que trabaja en un persa donde ubica su puesto ofreciendo de todo a su clientela, trabaja los días viernes, sábado y domingo y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en la ciudad de Santiago, donde encuentra gran variedad de articulos y novedades a bajo costo por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará articulos para navidad y productos de paquetería.
Una de las  metas de Jacqueline es crecer y tener siempre mercadería actualizada para ofrecer a su clientela, así con esto generar mayores ingresos y optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Jacqueline vive junto a su esposo e hijos de 10 y dos de 9 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel familiar es tener su casa propia para darles una buen pasar a sus hijos, y a nivel laboral continuar con el rubro y crecer dia a dia.
Ella está muy agradecida y contenta de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones.
Comuna perteneciente a la capital de Chile, ubicada en el extremo noroeste de región metropolitana. El origen del nombre viene del mapudungun (lengua mapuche): "kila", que significa “tres” y "kura" que significa “piedra”, por lo que se deduce que el nombre equivale a "tres piedras", como  el nombre que le dieron los primeros habitantes de este valle en referencia a los tres cerros que son perfectamente visibles.
texts.en:
This communal bank, El Remolino, is made up of 21 entrepreneurs who make a living in various businesses, including market stall, clothing sales, toy sales, lingerie, vegetable sales, household items sales, services, and other areas.  All are from the community of Quilicura in the city of Santiago.

Jacqueline is the president of the communal bank group.  In the photograph she's seated in the first row, the first from the left, wearing a black-and-white shirt.  Her hair is dark brown and she's wearing it back with sunglasses on her head.

She has made a living in the open-air market and packaging business for two years.  She says she sets up her stall in an open-air market, selling everything to her customers.  She works Friday, Saturday, and Sunday according to her availability.  She buys the merchandise and supplies she needs in the city of Santiago, where she finds a wide variety of articles and novelties at economically advantageous low costs.

With the loan she'll buy Christmas items and packaging products.

One of Jacqueline's goals is to grow and always have current merchandise to sell to her customers so she can generate greater income and have a better quality of life.

Jacqueline lives with her husband and her children, ages 10 and 9.  Her dream for her family is to have her own house to give her children a good home; for work, to continue with her job and grow every day.

She's very grateful for and happy about this opportunity from Fondo Esperanza because it lets her invest in her business.  She says the trainings have been fundamental for her business as well as her personal development because she has learned to better organize and distribute her income and investments.

Quilicura is a commune in the capital of Chile, located in the far northeast part of the metropolitan region. The origin of the name is from Mapudungun (the Mapuche language): "kila" 'three' and "kura" 'rock.'  So the name Quilicura means "Three Rocks," the name given by the first inhabitants of this valley to the three hills that are perfectly visible.

loans.use: to buy Christmas items and packaging products

loans.name: Gabriela Alejandra

texts.es:
GABRIELA ALEJANDRA tiene 21 años de edad es casada tiene un hijo de cuatro años, vive con el hijo en casa de unos familiares en la ciudad de San José de Chimbo.

GABRIELA ALEJANDRA se dedica a la compra y venta de mariscos. Solicita el crédito para comprar pescado, camarón, langosta. Las compras y las ventas las realizará en la ciudad de Guaranda.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá aumentar los ingresos para el bienestar de la familia. 

El sueño es mejorar el nivel de vida. En el tiempo libre le gusta caminar por los campos.
texts.en:
Gabriela Alejandra is 21 years old, she is married and has a 4-year-old son. She lives with her son in a relative's home in the city of San José de Chimbo. Gabriela Alejandra makes her living buying and selling seafood. 

She seeks this loan to buy fish, prawns and lobsters. She will buy and sell the products in the city of Guaranda. Using this loan, she will be able to increase the income for the family's wellbeing. Her dream is to improve their living standards. In her free time, Gabriela likes to go for a walk in the fields.

loans.use: to buy fish, prawns and lobsters.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan cliente Kiva, Estelí, soltero, su nivel académico es hasta sexto grado de primaria, de oficio agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de tabaco desde hace 7 años. El utilizo su anterior préstamo para cubrir costo de producción agrícola como maíz y  frijol,  en la compra de insumos para darles un mejor mantenimiento a su siembra y tener buenos rendimientos de su cosecha. Ahora requiere el este credito  para invertirlo en la compra de insumo, abonos y pago de mano de obra para sembrar media manzana de tabaco, ya que su deseo es ofrecer un productos de buena calidad que pueda vender a un buen precio para obtener mejores ingresos, el espera poder contar con apoyo de  otros créditos para seguir trabajando en su negocio, su meta próxima es ampliar el área de siembra de tabaco.
texts.en: Juan, is a Kiva client, he is a resident of Estelí, he is single, studies up to 6th grade, farmer, he started growing tobacco seven years ago.  He used his previous loan to cover production costs of corn and beans, and to buy inputs to maintain his crops and have a good harvest.  He now wants this loan to buy inputs, deposits and labor to grow 0.8 acres of tobacco.  He hopes to offer good quality products and sell them at a good price to obtain more income, he hopes to have the support of more loans to be able to work in his business, his next goal is to expand the land where to grow tobacco.

loans.use: to buy inputs, pay deposits and labor to grow 0.8 acres of tobacco.

loans.name: Hrach

texts.en: Hrach lives in Lusakert village with his wife Seda (in the picture) and two children. Together with his wife, Hrach is involved in cattle breeding. They keep 2 cows and 30 chickens. Seda uses the milk in cheese production and sells it in the local markets. They get income which is enough for covering only the family's daily costs. Hrach would like to expand his agricultural business. He has applied for this loan to rent an agricultural land. This will help him to cultivate fruits and vegetables and will significantly increase his income. With the other part of the loan, Hrach will purchase forage for feeding the livestock. This loan is very important for Hrach to increase his income and ensure a better future for his beloved children.

loans.use: to pay for renting agricultural land and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Narantuya is 48 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a small house in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband, Tomorbaatar, is a herdsman and goes back and forth to countryside and province center. Her daughter Battsetseg, age 21, studies at the university and her son, Tserennadmid, age 15, goes to the local secondary school. 

Narantuya has been producing organic dairy products since 2001. She and her husband have been breeding cattle and sheep for years and have lot of experience in organic dairy products' production and sales. She is now requesting MNT 500000 to purchase forage for herds for winter. She and her husband are hard-working, helpful, and neat people.

Picture of the borrower was taken in rental counter of organic dairy products retail. It is not bakery where she works.

loans.use: to purchase forage for herds for winter.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей использовал полученные от КИВА средства по назначению: купил пленку про запас, и она пригодилась весной, когда ветром сорвало пленку на одной из теплиц и пришлось срочно ее менять. Кроме того Сергей закупил уголь, удобрения и все это помогло сделать сезон успешным. Более того, за счет полученной прибыли семья Сергей смогла сделать хороший ремонт в доме, поменять окна, сделать санузел, душевую кабину, а также приобрести компьютер и провести интернет. 
Сергею понадобились дополнительные средства суммой в 22 000 гривен для устройства отопления в теплице для рассады. Он планирует приобрести котёл на 3 000 гривен, а также трубы для отопления на 2 000 гривен. Оставшиеся средства Сергей хочет потратить на закупку пленки для второй теплицы – 8 000 гривен, и семян на 9 000 гривен. Сергей понимает, что ему нужно развиваться дальше, поэтому он хочет приобрести качественные семена, сделать теплицы под две пленки и переделать теплицу под отопление.
texts.en:
Sergei used his Kiva funds as intended: he stocked up on plastic film, and it came in handy in the spring when the winds tore the covering off one of his greenhouses and it needed to be replaced quickly. Additionally, Sergei stocked up on coal and fertilizers and, as the result, the season was successful. Furthermore, thanks to the additional profits, Sergei's family was able to carry out substantial repairs in their home, replace windows, install a new toilet and shower, as well as purchase a computer and connect it to the internet.

Sergei needs additional funds in the amount of 22,000 hryvnia in order to install heating in the greenhouse he uses for seedlings. He is planning to purchase a boiler for 3,000 hryvnia and pipes for the heating system for 2,000 hryvina. He would like to use the remaining funds to buy covering for a second greenhouse for 8,000 hryvnia and seeds for 9,000 hryvnia. Sergei understands that he needs to continue developing his business, which is why he wants to buy quality seeds, install double covering on his greenhouses and a heating system in his seedling greenhouse.

loans.use: to buy a boiler and pipes for a greenhouse heating system, as well as plastic film and seeds for his greenhouses

loans.name: Liliana Maria

texts.es:
Liliana Maria tiene 27 años de edad de estado civil soltera no tiene hijos vive con los padres en el Recinto EL JOBO perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Liliana Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. El sueño comprar un carro y un terreno para seguir sembrando. En los tiempos libres le gusta descansar y escuchar musica romantica.
texts.en:
Liliana Maria, 27, is single, without children and lives with her parents in the El Jobo which belongs to the Ventanas canton of the Los Ríos province. 

She makes her living working in agriculture, planting corn and rice. With this loan, she will be able to buy supplies such as fertilizers, compost and insecticides to prevent infestations and outbreaks. She buys her goods in the city of Ventanas. 

The loan has helped her to increase her income and cultivate the crops. Liliana Maria's dream is to buy a cart and a plot of land in order to continue sowing crops. 

In her free time, she likes to relax and listen to romantic music.

loans.use: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products like flour, cheese, salt, soft drinks, tomatoes, and sauces, etc. to make his pizza.

loans.name: Lumiere Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe LUMIÈRE sont essentiellement de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques à  HAMDALLAYE dans la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur 9ème  prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
AOUA fait le commerce de chaussures à travers ce groupe de femmes. Elle se tient en deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt environ 200 paires de chaussures en plastique qu’elle revend en détail sur place et au marché de Hamdallaye. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22 500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The five members of the Lumiere group are mainly married women of an average age of 37 years with four children. Most of them live in monogamous families at Hamdallaye in Sikasso.
This is their ninth loan from the Soro Yiriwaso micro financial institution. Their aim is to satisfy their customers.
Aoua sells shoes through this group of women. She is the second member from left to right in the picture.
With her loan she hopes to buy about 200 pairs of plastic shoes which she will sell retail locally and at the market in Hamdallaye.
She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 22 500 FCFA,  some of which she will use to pay back her loan and the interests and the rest she will save.

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Rebati

texts.en:
Rebati  is 27 years old and is a physically-challenged lady living with her mother, sister and her brother-in-law. Rebati  is an active woman having good rapport with her neighbors.  She does not want to be a burden on her sister's family. She started a general store in her village with the support of her sister and her brother-in-law, who is a daily laborer. She sells biscuits, cakes, wafers, chocolates, etc. and she wants to add some variety items like pens, notebooks, pencils, rice, lentils, etc. 

There is no other general store in her village and the demand for the items is great but she is not able to get the products due to her poor financial condition. She applied for a loan of 30,000 INR to purchase the above products for her general store. She says that if she adds a variety of items then she can meet the customers' demand and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase pens, notebooks, pencils, rice, lentils, etc. for her general store

loans.name: Gamaliel De Jesus

texts.es: Gamaliel, originario de Estelí, casado, de oficio agricultor se dedica a la siembra de tomate, maíz  y frijoles. El cuenta que su primer crédito le fue de gran ayuda porque lo utilizo para la compra de  insumos y pago mano de obra, para   poder cultivar media manzana de tomate, de esta manera obtener buenos rendimiento en la producción de su cosecha. Pero el sueño de Gamaliel es ampliar  su negocio es por eso que hoy en día, realiza su segundo crédito Kiva, para invertir en su negocio en la compra de insumos    como abonos, fertilizantes. Todos los productos necesarios para su siembra, el cual estima que este crédito le será de mucha ayuda porque con las ganancias  obtenidas podrá  seguir invirtiendo en la producción de tomate , sus planes futuros es seguir trabajando en la  siembra de tomate, atraves de estenegocio ha podido mejorar sus ingresos . Su meta es  ampliar sus areas de siembre y obtener mejores ingresos para ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Gamaliel is from Estelí and is married. He works in agriculture growing tomatoes, corn and beans. He says that his first loan cycle was a great help because he used it to buy supplies and pay day labor to cultivate about 0.87 acres. In this way, he was able to get a good profit from his harvest. Gamaliel's dream however is to expand his business. Because of this, he is now taking out his second Kiva loan to invest in his business by purchasing supplies including fertilizers. 

These products are necessary for planting and he estimates that this loan will be of much help to him because the earnings obtained will allow him to continue investing in producing tomatoes. His future plans are to continue growing tomatoes because he has been able to improve his earnings through this business. His goal is to expand the land used for planting and receive a better income to offer a better future to his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies including fertilizers.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна использовала предыдущий кредит от КИВА для того, чтобы закупить обувь, а также кашемировые пальто, которые сейчас очень хорошо расходятся. Пополнив торговую точку товаром, Татьяна смогла увеличить свою выручку. 
В этот раз Татьяна тоже планирует использовать полученные от КИВА средства в размере 4 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести дополнительную партию обуви под реализацию.
texts.en:
Tatyana used her previous Kiva loan to purchase footwear and cashmere coats, which are currently selling very well. Having restocked her shop, she was able to increase her profits.

This time, Tatyana also plans to use Kiva funds in the amount of 4,000 hryvnia to purchase an additional lot of footwear for resale.

loans.use: to purchase an additional lot of footwear for resale

loans.name: Tuvshinjargal

texts.en: Tuvshinjargal, 25, lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  Her mother has been running a loan business which she now owns. In order to maintain healthy business activity she needs a new automobile, which will be used for transportation and delivery; they have been spending a considerable amount of money paying for taxis. So Tuvshinjargal is requesting a loan of 4,700,000 MNT to buy a new environmentally friendly car. The car she wants to buy runs on natural gas and emits less smoke thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution.In Mongolia, especially in winter time, air pollution increases drastically so usage of such a car should be encouraged. As a result, the family will be able to generate more income, partially because her husband can use the car as a taxi, which will provide another source of income and more importantly they can contribute to environmental protection

loans.use: to buy environmentally friendly car

loans.name: Tumen

texts.en:
Mr. Tumen, 30 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been working for four years as a taxi driver. His 7-year-old daughter goes to elementary school, while his wife works in a small sewing business entity. 

In the past, he has borrowed twice from our organization to buy a house and car, repaying his loan on the established schedule without delay. This time, he is requesting the loan of 5,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase a new car because his old car has deteriorated over the years. 

The new car that he wants to buy is environmentally friendly as it emits less smoke because its engine is operated through natural gas. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase an environmentally friendly car running on natural-gas

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья живет и занимается сельским хозяйством в с. Гладковка. Тепличное хозяйство у нее уже 13 лет, Наталья выращивает редис, помидоры, огурцы, капусту, перец и баклажаны на собственном участке в 55 соток.  
Сумма в 20 000 гривен понадобилась Наталии для того, чтобы закупить удобрения, семена, провести капельное орошение, то есть закупить трубы, шланги, краники и т.п., а также установить отопление в теплицах, подготовив их к сезону. Наталья надеется продолжать заниматься тепличным делом, по возможности расширяя свое хозяйство.
texts.en: Natalya lives and farms in the village of Gladkovka. She has been running her greenhouse farm for the past 13 years, cultivating radishes, tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbage, peppers and eggplants on her plot of 0.55 acres. Natalya needs the sum of 20,000 hryvnia in order to purchase fertilizers and seeds, to install drip irrigation - that is, to purchase pipes, hoses, faucets etc. - as well as to install a heating system in her greenhouses, making them ready for the growing season. She hopes to continue being a greenhouse farmer, gradually expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers, and to install irrigation and heating systems in her greenhouses

loans.name: Jamileh

texts.en: Jamileh is a friendly and above all a hardworking woman. She’s from Lebanon and is 41 years old. She is married to Ali and they have two children who are attending school. Jamileh and her husband are working really hard to provide the family with needed income.  And since she noticed that their income does not satisfy their needs, she decided to launch her clothing business and open her own women and children's shop with the small amount of money she already had. She sells a wide variety of clothes from which she earns a fair amount of money daily. Her husband also works in car trading, as he is their main income provider. To better support her husband, she’s requesting a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. She will be using the loan to buy more merchandise for her business such as pants, t-shirts and many other items. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy more pants, t-shirts and many other items to sell

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nélida, de 35 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo con quien se casó desde hace 3 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijas a los que cría en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Pampa blanca.   
Su principal fuente de ingreso es la venta de comida a las enfermeras de su anexo. Quienes le pagan por la alimentación que reciben durante el día. Además abrió una tienda de comestibles hace 3 años, donde vende productos de primera necesidad a los pobladores de su zona. Por su parte su esposo, trabaja como chofer llevando carga en el camión de sus padres a todo el país, “a veces se ausenta varios días”, comenta. Por ello, ella tiene que administrar sus sembríos de papa, olluco y demás tubérculos; en terrenos heredados, donde supervisa el crecimiento y ya en la cosecha lo comercializa a la capital del país, donde aprovecha el trabajo de su esposo para trasladarlos y obtener mejores ganancias. Ahora piensa trasladar sus cosas a un cuarto seguro, pues el sismo que ocurrió hace algunos meses, rajó la pared de casa, la que derrumbará para construir una más resistente. Asimismo se encuentra cosechando olluco en gran cantidad, “este año el precio en el mercado es muy alto, por ello sembraré más”, comenta.
Ella pertenece al banco comunal “pampa blanca” y este es el crédito número 8 con MFP, donde se siente feliz, ya que tiene muchos años trabajando con su asociación, donde los integrantes son personas, humanas y sobre todo con muchas ganas de ayudarse entre ellos.
Nélida, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de abono orgánico para su próxima siembra de olluco; que dentro de unos días comenzará a esparcir.
texts.en:
Nélida, 35, is a hard-working woman. She lives together with her husband whom she married 3 years ago. They have 3 girls who they brought up in their own home located in Pampa Blanca. Her main source of income comes from the sale of food to nurses from her dependency. They pay her for the food they receive during the day. Nélida also opened a grocery store three years ago where she sells basic goods to those living in her area. Her husband, meanwhile, works as a lorry driver, transporting goods across the country in his parents' lorry. "Sometimes he is away for several days," says Nélida. That is why Nélida needs to sow her potato, olluco and other tuber crops on plots of land that were inherited, and Nélida tends to them to ensure they grow. During the harvest season, she sells the products in the city's capital, Lima, making the most of her husband's job to transport the goods and obtain greater profits. Nélida is now thinking of moving her possessions to a safer place as the earthquake some months ago split the wall of her home. She will knock it down to rebuild a stronger one. Nélida is also harvesting a large volume of olluco, "This year, the market price is very high, which is why I will plant more" she comments.

Nélida belongs to the “Pampa Blanca” communal bank and this is her 8th loan with MFP. She feels happy with MFP as she has been working for many years with this association, where the members are people, who treat others as human beings, and who, above all are keen to help each other.

Nélida will invest the money she is seeking to purchase organic fertilizers for her next olluco crop which she will scatter in a few days' time.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
Freddy, de 20 años de edad, es un hombre joven, amable, emprendedor, con ganas de superación. Es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en la casa de su tía en compañía de sus 3 primos.
La actividad que realiza Freddy es la venta de carne de res, compra la carne en el camal municipal de la localidad a los ganaderos ocasionales y los vende en un puesto en el mercado, donde atiende a sus clientes quienes lo buscan por la buena calidad de la carne que pone a la venta. Trabaja en este rubro hace 6 años y ha logrado ganarse la preferencia de su clientela quienes además lo recomiendan con otras personas que luego se convierten en sus clientes habituales. Se inició en esta actividad por recomendación de su  tía quien le enseñó todo lo necesario para desarrollar esta función. Empezó comprando pequeñas cantidades de carnes y poco a poco fue aumentando incrementando su capital pudiendo aumentar también sus compras. 
Considera que su negocio es bastante rentable por las ganancias económicas que recibe además la demanda de este producto es constante permitiéndole tener sus ventas estables. Es por ello que desea continuar con su negocio y continuar ganando el dinero necesario que le permitan solventar sus gastos universitarios. Este es el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecido con el crédito recibido para continuar con su negocio y desea seguir contando con más oportunidades crediticias, para ello se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Por otro lado, asegura que se siente a gusto trabajando con su banco comunal, pues considera que todos sus miembros son personas comprometidas con sus obligaciones.
Con el monto solicitado de 2800 nuevo soles comprará de 3 reses cada uno valorizado en 900 nuevos soles, para la venta en su puesto en el mercado. Buscará precios bajos por su compra en volumen para tener un margen de ganancias.
texts.en:
Freddy, age 20, is a kind and enterprising young man who has the desire to succeed.  He is single and has no children.  He lives in his aunt’s house with his three cousins.

Freddy sells beef.  He buys the meat from ranchers in the Camal municipality.  He sells the meat at his stand at the market.  That is where he tends to his customers who look for the good quality of meat that he sells.  He has been working in this field for six years, and he has managed to win over his customers.  They recommend him to other people who later become his regular customers.

He started this business activity by taking his aunt’s recommendation.  She taught him everything he needed to know to develop his business.  He started out by purchasing small amounts of meat.  Little by little he was increasing his capital, and he was able to also increase his purchases.

He feels that his business is profitable enough because of the income that he gets.  Also, the demand for this product is constant, allowing him to have stable sales.  He therefore wishes to continue with his business and to continue earning the money he needs to pay for his university expenses.

This is his fifth loan with MFP.  He is grateful for the loan he received in order to continue with his business.  He wishes to continue to have more loan opportunities.  Therefore, he pledges to be punctual with his payments.

He confirms that he feels good working with his communal bank.  He considers all of the members to be people who are committed to their obligations.

He will use the requested 2,800 soles to buy three head of cattle at 900 soles for each one.  He will buy them to sell at his stand at the market.  He will look for low prices for buying in volume in order to have a profit margin.

loans.use: to buy three head of cattle.

loans.name: Liliya

texts.ru:
Лилия живёт и работает в Мелитополе. Она торгует на привокзальном рынке чаем и кофе. У нее есть своё торговое место, работает в одной и той же сфере вот уже 14 лет. 
Сумму в 17 000 гривен Лилия берет для того, чтобы сделать ремонт в кухне и ванной комнате. Как и многие другие среднестатистические украинцы, Лилия не может позволить себе сделать даже самый простой косметический ремонт на собственные средства. Поэтому финансовая помощь от КИВА станет для нее долгожданным решением проблемы, которая уже давно не дает ей покоя.
texts.en: Liliya lives and works in the city of Melitopol. She sells tea and coffee from her retail spot at a market located near the city's train station. She has been working in this job for the past 14 years. Liliya is borrowing the sum of 17,000 hryvnia in order to carry out repairs in her kitchen and bathroom. Like many average Ukrainians, she cannot afford to pay for even the simplest cosmetic repairs. This is why financial assistance from Kiva will become a welcome solution to a problem that has been bothering her for a long time.

loans.use: to carry out repairs in her kitchen and bathroom

loans.name: Karla Maria

texts.es: Karla María 29 años de edad, es una mujer casada con tres hijos menores de edad uno de 12,10 y 4 años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en la ciudad de Chichigalpa departamento de Chinandega, donde predomina el ron, la caña y la azúcar,  ella se dedica a la venta de Granos Básicos como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, maíz, frijoles, jabón, pastas, entre otros productos más, los que compra en una desgranadora maíz y trilladora de arroz,  aparte de eso también tiene venta de mercadería en general como: ropa, zapato y cosméticos, los cuales los compra ya sea en Chinandega, León y a veces en Managua,  Karla está solicitando financiamiento para comprar arroz, maíz, frijoles y así poder revender a los mercados, al igual para incrementar variedades de ropa, sandalias, camisas de varón y de mujer, y variedad de cosméticos, y así dejar satisfechos a sus clientes fijos y eventuales que ella tiene.
texts.en: Karla María is 29 years old.  She is married and has three dependent children who are 12,10 and 4 years old.  Her business is located in the city of Chichigalpa, Chinandega Department, where rum, cane and sugar prevail.  Karla María makes her living selling household staples like: rice, sugar, cooking oil, corn, beans, soap, pasta and additional items.  She makes her purchases in corn husking and rice threshing facilities.  In addition, she sells general merchandise like: clothing, shoes and cosmetics, which she purchases in Chinandega, León and sometimes Managua.  Karla is requesting the loan to purchase rice, corn and beans to re-sell to the markets.  She will also use the loan to increase the variety of clothing, sandals, men's and women's shirts and cosmetics that she has available.  This way she will be able to satisfy both her regular and occasional customers.

loans.use: to increase supplies for her business, which is selling household staples in the city of Chichigalpa, where demand has increased.

loans.name: Edison José

texts.es: Edison de 42 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y es  padre de5 hijos en las edades de 12 a 17 años; con ellos sueña en verlos convertidos en profesionales de éxito, por lo cual trabaja en su propio restaurante, con mucho esmero, dedicación y disciplina  para lograrlo. El aprovechó que empleados empresas del sector financiero, ubicadas a su alrededor,  no encontraban un sitio donde almorzar y su decisión de ampliar sus ingresos la convirtió en una oportunidad, para emprender su negocio acorde al requerimiento del mercado. Inicialmente empezó a preparar y vender almuerzos y posteriormente agregó desayunos y meriendas. Sus ventas las realiza una parte de contado y otra a crédito, estudiando muy bien a su clientela para recuperar efectivamente sus cuentas por cobrar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos en mayor volumen en depósitos comerciales que le ofrecen precios especiales por este tipo de compras. Su meta es aumentar el número de clientes, para aumentar sus ingresos, que le faciliten ofrecer una educación de calidad a sus hijos y este es justamente su mayor desafío.
texts.en:
Edison is 42 years old.  He lives with his spouse and is a father to five children who are between the ages of 12 and 17 years old.  He dreams of seeing them become successful professionals, so he works with great care, dedication, and discipline at his own restaurant to achieve that.  He took advantage of the fact that employees at businesses in the financial sector, located nearby, had nowhere to eat lunch.  His decision to expand his income became an opportunity to make his business meet the needs of the market.  

At the beginning, he prepared and sold lunches and later added breakfast and snacks.  He accepts cash and part of his sales are on credit.  He studies his customers well to collect what they owe.  

He is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase primary materials and ingredients in larger volumes at commercial stores that offer special prices for this type of purchase.
